Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2980330

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.

Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that many potential applicants discourage themselves from applying to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. TriNet always strives to hire the most qualified candidate for a particular role, ensuring we deliver outstanding results for our small and medium-size customers. So if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every single qualification in the job description, nobody’s perfect – and we encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

A Brief Overview

The Data Analyst utilizes their knowledge of finance, accounting, data science and business strategies to provide insights to TriNet's management team through various analysis functions. The position is responsible for preparing financial reports and analyses for the Data & Analytics organization and serves to assist with company needs. The position provides regular support to other Functions including Revenue, Marketing, Strategy and Finance.

Locations

Atlanta, GA

What You Will Do


Provide insights, analysis & recommendations on revenue pipeline, effectiveness of commercial programs, service operations, Cost to Serve, Cost to Acquire, Customer Profitability and Go-To-Market initiatives. Analyze results and recommend actions.
Leverages business knowledge and expertise to drive business process improvement. Identify and address areas of risk that threaten the success of the company. Advise and implement solutions to mitigate risk.
Supports consolidated commercial forecast process. Implements dashboards (Tableau) and scenario analysis (Anaplan/Excel) to support operational & strategic decisions. Analyes monthly results and provides recommendations to financial & non-financial leaders.
Coordinate with Revenue Leaders, Financial Planning and Analysis, and Insurance Services to ensure revenue and costs are captured accurately
Responsible for compiling and supporting key reporting metrics (KPI) and other visual materials
Cross train staff to mitigate risks to key processes
Assist in automation of repetitive data aggregation/manipulation tasks to enable greater focus on value-add analysis
Performs other duties as assigned
Complies with all policies and standards



Education Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience preferred
Master’s in Quantitative Management or Business Administration preferred



Experience Qualifications


Typically new graduate of MQM/MBA program or 2+ years



Skills And Abilities


Tableau development experience preferred
Anaplan model builder experience preferred
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Excellent presentation and facilitation skills
Ability to lead others



Licenses and Certifications


Tableau Certified Data Analyst preferred
Anaplan Model Builder certification preferred



Travel Requirements

Minimal

Work Environment


Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable office or home setting. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable persons with disabilities to perform the essential functions.



The preferred location for this role is Atlanta, GA, and the salary range for this location is $62,200.00 to $105,700.00. All qualified external applicants will be considered for an in-office role, based in Atlanta. All qualified internal candidates are encouraged to apply and consider relocation to Atlanta and may be considered for remote hire at the company’s discretion. The candidate’s final salary offer will be based on the candidate’s skills, education, work location and experience.

A candidate’s compensation may also include bonuses consistent with TriNet’s corporate bonus plan.

Additionally, subject to applicable eligibility requirements, TriNet offers permanent full-time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, and vision plans, life and disability insurance, a 401(K) savings plan, an employee stock purchase plan, eleven (11) Company observed holidays, PTO and a comprehensive leave program. Please click the following link for detailed information about our benefits offerings: https://www.trinet.com/documents/blt5b61a1040aae1904

Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity.

TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact recruiting@trinet.com to request such an accommodation.

About Us

TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.

Please note that at this time, TriNet requires colleagues reporting to TriNet offices, engaging in in-person activities (including off-sites) or engaging in TriNet sponsored business travel, to be fully vaccinated (as defined by the CDC) against COVID-19 or provide proof of a negative PCR test each week. TriNet will consider requests for reasonable accommodations for documented medical reasons and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

TriNet is providing access to a mobile app for colleagues to submit proof of vaccination or negative test results. Please do not include proof of vaccine status or any indication of a possible request for an accommodation when submitting your application materials. If applicable, TriNet will follow up with you directly to request proof of vaccination and to discuss any potential accommodations.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Integrated Real Estate Group




AWARD-WINNING REAL ESTATE DEVELOPMENT & MANAGEMENT

Headquartered in the Dallas-Fort Worth area, Integrated Real Estate Group has been an industry leader in property management, development, construction, housing solutions, and senior living lifestyles. Integrated Real Estate Group’s sustained growth is underpinned by its unique and innovative business model, with four specialized divisions working synergistically to provide clients with a more efficient and effective solution for their real estate development needs.




We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our fast-paced and growing Analytics team in Southlake, Texas.




Essential Requirements

Passion for learning, quick thinking and problem solving.
Actively conceptualizing, applying, analyzing, and/or evaluating information gathered.
Assist with development and acquisition due diligence, including creating and maintaining project due diligence folders and oversee collection of project due diligence data.
Conduct in-depth research on market conditions for each asset class.

Desired Skills, Experience and Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Finance, Business Analytics, Business Administration, Economics, Real Estate, etc.) REQUIRED.
Some analysis experience is preferred.
Above average Microsoft Excel skills.
Organized and Detailed.
Comfortable reading and understanding data.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications.
Enjoys critical thinking and problem solving.




Integrated Real Estate Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Integrated Real Estate Group participates in e-verify for employment authorization verification.

Title: ALTERNANCE - Assistant Data Analyst F/H
Description:
Poste

From the house of dream to the house of talents

« Quoi que vous fassiez - pour le travail ou le plaisir - faites-le avec passion ! Vivez avec passion... »* Christian Dior

Christian Dior fut le couturier du rêve. Dès la fondation de sa Maison en 1947, marquée par la révolution du New Look, il métamorphose ses songes en de merveilleuses créations. Son esprit visionnaire n’a eu de cesse de magnifier les femmes du monde entier, inspirant aujourd’hui et plus que jamais ses successeurs. « Le tissu est le seul véhicule de nos rêves (…). La mode, en somme, est issue d’un rêve, et le rêve, c’est une évasion », écrivait-il dans son ouvrage Je suis couturier. Au fil de ses collections, Monsieur Dior est devenu le démiurge du bonheur de ses muses.

Aujourd’hui, riche de cet héritage d’exception et d’une communauté de plus de 7 500 talents, notre Maison incarne plus que jamais la Maison des Talents pensé par Christian Dior. Dans plus de 40 pays, nous faisons rayonner notre savoir-faire, notre audace et notre excellence à travers la passion et la créativité de nos collaborateurs. Rejoignez-nous et créez votre avenir dans notre univers généreux, disruptif et ambitieux où nous grandissons dans l’excellence, le courage et l’optimisme.


Le Petit Dictionnaire de la Mode


Missions

DETAIL DE LA MISSION

Contexte

Au sein de l’Analytics Factory (siège Monde), vous assisterez l’équipe dans la production et l’analyse des données clients afin d’aider aux prises de décisions. Vous serez amené à être en contact avec nos interlocuteurs en Zone ainsi que les divisions Produits et équipes Marketing Client, dans le but de les soutenir dans leur suivi client.

Descriptif

En fonction de votre profil, nous pourrons définir une mission principale : réalisation d’un score d’appétence produits, retravailler la segmentation clients actuelle, affiner la définition des clients inactifs pour mettre en place des traitements différenciés, …

En Périphérie De Cette Mission Principale, Vous Participerez à La Production Et à L’analyse Quotidiennes Des Données Clients


Réalisation d’études et d’analyses clients (analyse du comportement d’achat, profils clients, parcours clients, segmentations)
Analyses des performances des produits et des collections (ventes, tendances, recrutement etc.)
Gestion opérationnelle des campagnes marketing : recommandation de ciblage, comptages et créations
Mise en place de tableaux de bord afin de suivre la performance des campagnes (newsletters, mailing…)
Analyse des impacts des différentes actions clientèles monde (événements clients, …)


Profil

De formation Bac+5, type école d’ingénieur ou université spécialisée en statistiques


Dataiku / SQL indispensable
Rigueur, fiabilité et autonomie
Esprit d’équipe
Anglais indispensable


Ce que vous apprendrez au cours de cette alternance :

Vous pourrez développer vos compétences analytiques (lecture de résultats, analyse et communication pertinente des enseignements).

Vous aurez également l’occasion de mettre en application vos compétences statistiques à l’aide notamment de Dataiku, dont vous pourrez de plus améliorer votre maîtrise.

Vous participerez à la vie courante d’un grand groupe de luxe, en découvrirez l’univers et les problématiques clients.

A titre personnel, vous développerez vos compétences relationnelles au contact des différentes équipes en Zone, Marketing Client et des divisions Produit, ainsi que votre rigueur et votre autonomie.

Encourageant l’inclusion et la diversité sous toutes ses formes, Christian Dior Couture s'est engagé depuis 2013 dans une démarche en faveur de l'emploi des personnes en situation de handicap, et de la valorisation de toutes les singularités.
Show more

Title: Analista de Dados Online - Comercial
Description:
Somos a DIGI Portugal, uma nova Empresa de Telecomunicações no mercado português, que integra o Grupo DIGI, com mais de 30 anos de história, presente em vários países europeus (Roménia, Espanha, Itália, etc).

Procuramos talentos que queiram construir connosco uma história de sucesso em Portugal.

Nesta perspetiva de crescimento pretendemos contratar um(a) Analista de Dados Online, especializado em venda online e Marketing Digital, com as seguintes funções:




Principais Responsabilidades:




Recolha e Análise de Dados: Recolher, limpar e analisar dados da nossa loja online e plataformas digitais para descobrir insights sobre o comportamento dos clientes, tendências de vendas e desempenho das nossos serviços.
Monitorização de Desempenho: Monitorizar indicadores-chave de desempenho (KPIs) como fontes de tráfego, taxas de conversão, valor médio dos pedidos e métricas de retenção de clientes.
Relatórios: Preparar relatórios detalhados e painéis de controlo para comunicar descobertas, tendências e recomendações acionáveis aos interessados.
Otimização: Identificar oportunidades de melhoria na jornada do utilizador e esforços promocionais com base na análise de dados.
Análise de Concorrência: Realizar análises competitivas para comparar o desempenho da nossa loja online, identificar tendências de mercado e recomendar iniciativas estratégicas.
Visualização de Dados: Criar visualizações e apresentações para comunicar eficazmente insights e promover a tomada de decisões baseada em dados.
Previsão e Análise Preditiva: Utilizar dados históricos e técnicas de modelagem preditiva para prever tendências de vendas, necessidades de inventário e valor vitalício do cliente.




Qualificações:




Licenciatura em Marketing, Estatística ou área relacionada.
2-3 anos de experiência numa posição similar (Obrigatório).
Proficiência em inglês é essencial; (Espanhol é uma vantagem).
Fortes competências analíticas com proficiência em ferramentas de análise de dados como Excel e Google Analytics, bem como ferramentas de visualização como Looker Studio, Power BI e Tableau (Obrigatório).
Compreensão dos princípios e melhores práticas de e-commerce, incluindo otimização de sites e mapeamento da jornada do cliente (Obrigatório).
Experiência com plataformas de e-commerce e familiaridade com sistemas CRM e ferramentas de automação de marketing é vantajosa.
Capacidade de traduzir dados complexos em insights acionáveis e recomendações estratégicas.
Excelentes competências de comunicação e colaboração para trabalhar eficazmente com equipas multifuncionais.










Caso esta função se enquadre no seu plano de carreira e queira fazer parte da história de sucesso que estamos a construir, não deixe de se candidatar.

Envie por favor o seu CV para recrutamento@digi.pt, ao qual daremos resposta no prazo máximo de duas semanas caso seja o(a) candidato(a) selecionado(a).




***A Digi Portugal atua de forma ética, pelo que não discrimina com base em critérios de ascendência, idade, sexo, orientação sexual, identidade de género, estado civil, situação familiar, situação económica, instrução, origem ou condição social, património genético, capacidade de trabalho reduzida, deficiência, doença crónica, nacionalidade, origem étnica ou raça, território de origem, língua, religião, convicções políticas ou ideológicas e filiação sindical, pelo que todas as candidaturas serão tratadas de acordo com critérios objetivos de avaliação comportamental e técnica, exclusivamente para identificação do perfil adequado.***

Show more
HTML:
Somos a DIGI Portugal, uma nova Empresa de Telecomunicações no mercado português, que integra o Grupo DIGI, com mais de 30 anos de história, presente em vários países europeus (Roménia, Espanha, Itália, etc).

Procuramos talentos que queiram construir connosco uma história de sucesso em Portugal.

Nesta perspetiva de crescimento pretendemos contratar um(a) Analista de Dados Online, especializado em venda online e Marketing Digital, com as seguintes funções:


Principais Responsabilidades:


  • Recolha e Análise de Dados: Recolher, limpar e analisar dados da nossa loja online e plataformas digitais para descobrir insights sobre o comportamento dos clientes, tendências de vendas e desempenho das nossos serviços.
  • Monitorização de Desempenho: Monitorizar indicadores-chave de desempenho (KPIs) como fontes de tráfego, taxas de conversão, valor médio dos pedidos e métricas de retenção de clientes.
  • Relatórios: Preparar relatórios detalhados e painéis de controlo para comunicar descobertas, tendências e recomendações acionáveis aos interessados.
  • Otimização: Identificar oportunidades de melhoria na jornada do utilizador e esforços promocionais com base na análise de dados.
  • Análise de Concorrência: Realizar análises competitivas para comparar o desempenho da nossa loja online, identificar tendências de mercado e recomendar iniciativas estratégicas.
  • Visualização de Dados: Criar visualizações e apresentações para comunicar eficazmente insights e promover a tomada de decisões baseada em dados.
  • Previsão e Análise Preditiva: Utilizar dados históricos e técnicas de modelagem preditiva para prever tendências de vendas, necessidades de inventário e valor vitalício do cliente.


Qualificações:


  • Licenciatura em Marketing, Estatística ou área relacionada.
  • 2-3 anos de experiência numa posição similar (Obrigatório).
  • Proficiência em inglês é essencial; (Espanhol é uma vantagem).
  • Fortes competências analíticas com proficiência em ferramentas de análise de dados como Excel e Google Analytics, bem como ferramentas de visualização como Looker Studio, Power BI e Tableau (Obrigatório).
  • Compreensão dos princípios e melhores práticas de e-commerce, incluindo otimização de sites e mapeamento da jornada do cliente (Obrigatório).
  • Experiência com plataformas de e-commerce e familiaridade com sistemas CRM e ferramentas de automação de marketing é vantajosa.
  • Capacidade de traduzir dados complexos em insights acionáveis e recomendações estratégicas.
  • Excelentes competências de comunicação e colaboração para trabalhar eficazmente com equipas multifuncionais.




Caso esta função se enquadre no seu plano de carreira e queira fazer parte da história de sucesso que estamos a construir, não deixe de se candidatar.

Envie por favor o seu CV para recrutamento@digi.pt, ao qual daremos resposta no prazo máximo de duas semanas caso seja o(a) candidato(a) selecionado(a).


***A Digi Portugal atua de forma ética, pelo que não discrimina com base em critérios de ascendência, idade, sexo, orientação sexual, identidade de género, estado civil, situação familiar, situação económica, instrução, origem ou condição social, património genético, capacidade de trabalho reduzida, deficiência, doença crónica, nacionalidade, origem étnica ou raça, território de origem, língua, religião, convicções políticas ou ideológicas e filiação sindical, pelo que todas as candidaturas serão tratadas de acordo com critérios objetivos de avaliação comportamental e técnica, exclusivamente para identificação do perfil adequado.***

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Na Gi Group fazemos parte de um Ecossistema Global de Soluções de RH, mudamos vidas e tornamos o mercado de trabalho mais agradável e sustentável para todos. Se queres ser Life Changer, descobre mais sobre o nosso impacto na mudança de vidas e as vantagens de ser um de nós. Juntos, podemos fazer a diferença!


Estamos a reforçar a nossa equipa em Lisboa com um/a Data Analyst que terá a missão de analisar, trabalhar e monitorizar indicadores económicos e de mercado contribuindo ativamente com inputs concretos para a tomada de decisões estratégicas.


Terás como principais responsabilidades:


  • Identificar, extrair e processar dados de fontes públicas relevantes (Pordata, INE, Banco de Portugal, Eurostat, etc.);
  • Integrar dados externos com bases de dados internas para obter insights sobre o mercado e os setores.
  • Garantir a qualidade, consistência e atualização dos dados recolhidos;
  • Análise e interpretação de dados;
  • Desenvolver modelos analíticos para identificar tendências e padrões relevantes;
  • Aplicar técnicas estatísticas e de machine learning para enriquecer a análise de dados;
  • Produção de Relatórios detalhados e dashboards interativos em Power BI para comunicar insights de forma clara e acessível;
  • Apresentar análises e recomendações estratégicas para diferentes stakeholders;
  • Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com equipas internas para compreender necessidades específicas de análise de dados;
  • Apoiar na tomada de decisões estratégicas com base em dados concretos;
  • Garantir que os insights gerados sejam compreensíveis e acionáveis para diferentes áreas da empresa.


Procuramos um perfil com:

  • Formação Superior em Ciência de Dados, Estatística, Economia, Engenharia Informática, Matemática Aplicada ou áreas relacionadas;
  • Experiência em recolha e análise de dados de fontes públicas e privadas;
  • Domínio de Power BI para criação de dashboards e relatórios interativos;
  • Conhecimento de SQL para manipulação de bases de dados internas;
  • Experiência com Python e R para análise estatística e machine learning;
  • Familiaridade com ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) e integração de dados;
  • Capacidade de trabalhar com grandes volumes de dados e garantir a sua qualidade.


Este é o momento certo para te juntares a nós! Começa a tua viagem como Life Changer, estamos à procura de pessoas talentosas e proativas, encontrarás um ambiente dinâmico e flexível.


  • Integração numa Multinacional em franca expansão no mercado português;
  • Formação inicial e contínua;
  • Possibilidade de progressão de carreira.


A Gi Group Holding reconhece e respeita a diversidade das pessoas e acredita que proporcionar igualdade de oportunidades, através de processos justos com base na meritocracia e competência profissional, valorizar a diversidade de semelhanças e diferenças que criam a singularidade de cada pessoa e promover uma cultura de inclusão eliminando fatores que desencorajam ou dificultam o acesso, a permanência e o crescimento no mundo do trabalho é fundamental para o seu sucesso. Conheça as nossas Políticas Globais de Alto Nível em gigrouholding.com/portugal > Compromisso Social” GI Group cumpre, deste modo, o normativo legal constante da Lei 4/2019, de 10 de Janeiro.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ( 1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Lisbon (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analytics
Description:
Randstad Digital is hiring a Technical Expert in Data Analytics to join a leading company based in Lisbon.




Responsibilities:

Skywise (Data Analytics Platform): Play a central role in maintaining and enhancing our data analytics and reporting infrastructure within Skywise. You will be responsible for supporting existing reports and developing new components to meet evolving business needs.

QlikSense (Dashboard & KPI Monitoring): Oversee the Reward Operations dashboard, ensuring its ongoing functionality and relevance. You will lead all initiatives related to the dashboard’s evolution, including enhancements and optimizations.

Escriba (SAP Document Management): Manage and implement updates to our contract documentation processes through Escriba. You will ensure this essential component remains aligned with business and legal requirements.







Skills:

Fluent level of English
Bachelor degree in Information Systems Technology or Data Analytics. (Master degree preferred)
Python knowledge including library like Pandas / Numpy mandatory
Skywise Palantir knowledge mandatory
Qliksense & Escriba knowledge is a plus
SAP HR knowledge is a plus




Offer:

Atractive salary package with benefits
Direct contract with the final client
Integration in a leading company with a multicultural environment
The opportunity to grow your skills and capabilities and career opportunities across the globe
A hybrid working model

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for a hybrid project based in Porto (2x/Week).




Requirements:

Minimum of 3 years experience as a Data Analyst.
Database management experience (SQL Sever).
Experience with Agile methodologies.
Experience with PowerBI/Tableau.
Fluency in English is mandatory.




Responsibilities:

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder’s decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to carolina.novais@decskill.com with reference CN/DAP.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Analista De Dados Junior
Description:
Na IRIUM Queremos que persigas sempre os teus sonhos!

Aqui, prepara-te para conquistares as tuas metas, enquanto desfrutas do caminho.

Atualmente encontramo-nos à procura de Analista de dados Junior: Requisitos: Acompanhar e monitorizar a performance de operações, de forma a assegurar a qualidade do serviço prestado end-to-end. Recolher e sistematizar dados operacionais das diferentes áreas da DGR, elaborando relatórios para diferentes intervenientes (i.e., controlo interno, clientes, fornecedores, etc.

). Desenvolver e implementar procedimentos para auditorias aleatórias e regulares das intervenções no terreno, incluindo atividades como a preparação de checklists de auditoria, a programação de auditorias e a análise inicial dos resultados. Identificar os equipamentos xTM que não cumprem os requisitos mínimos de rede. Acompanhar o estado atual do hardware dos componentes e terminais, identificando falhas ou necessidades de atualizações para garantir a operacionalidade. Gerir o funcionamento da rede xTM, incluindo atualização na rede das últimas versões de software autorizadas para xTM, e controlo e verificação de BIOS, bitlockers, templates, lista de fallbacks e IMs ativos. Auxiliar na análise das funcionalidades críticas dos sistemas de suporte à operação, contribuindo com insights para garantir a escalabilidade e flexibilidade. Identificar, criar e acompanhar as evoluções (EVs) junto das equipas de desenvolvimento.

Domínio de ferramentas Microsoft Office (preferencialmente Access e Excel). Capacidade de comunicação oral e escrita e domínio da língua inglesa. Conhecimentos de Power BI. Localização: Lisboa, Alfragide

Regime: Híbrido

O que oferecemos? Uma empresa inovadora e em crescimento, com muitas oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional.

Retribuição de acordo com a tua experiência e performance.

Acesso a retribuição flexível e seguro médico como benefício social.

Acesso ilimitado a formação tecnológica em modalidade livre.

Sobre a empresa: A IRIUM é uma empresa formada por profissionais dinâmicos e proativos.

Os nossos valores são a responsabilidade e o compromisso com a qualidade do trabalho.

Este é o espírito que procuramos na IRIUM, seja qual for a tua idade.

Se te reconheces nestes valores, esta é a tua empresa!

Podemos construir juntos o futuro.

Falamos?

Como candidatar-se: Envie a tua candidatura para: ****** Compromisso com a igualdade: Na IRIUM defendemos um mundo sem estereótipos nem limitações e acreditamos na igualdade para todos, princípios que subscrevemos no nosso Plano de Igualdade e Código de Ética, garantindo a igualdade de tratamento e de oportunidades à margem de qualquer condição pessoal, física ou social.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¿Te apasiona el BigData? ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo con una de las trayectorias más solventes en el mundo del Machine Learning, Analytics y BigData? ¿Te apetece trabajar en una compañía joven, participativa y especializada?




Para ello solo exigimos un requisito, que tus respuestas a las preguntas anteriores hayan sido: ¡SÍ!

En Daus Data, trabajamos continuamente para mantenernos a la vanguardia tecnológica, y además somos una empresa People Centric, ponemos al trabajador en el centro de todo lo que hacemos. Creemos en una cultura horizontal, sin egos, en un entorno donde se valoran tanto las ideas como las personas.




Buscamos a un/a Data Analyst con 2 años de experiencia en análisis de datos para generar insights accionables y apoyar la toma de decisiones basada en data.




¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia en Tableau en entornos reales.
Experiencia demostrada en SQL.
Alto nivel de inglés. Te integrarás en un equipo internacional y tu nivel de inglés debe ser alto, tanto escrito como hablado.
Valorable experiencia en PowerBI, Looker.
Valorable experiencia con AWS.
Valoraremos experiencia realizando procesos ETL.
Se valorará conocimientos de Python.




¿Cómo será tu día a día?




Comenzarás cada jornada con una reunión diaria de seguimiento de proyecto donde compartirás avances, bloqueos y próximos pasos con el equipo.
Tendrás autonomía para organizar tu trabajo, gestionando tus tareas y tiempos de forma flexible, con foco en la entrega de valor y resultados.
Participarás en reuniones de equipo semanales para compartir aprendizajes y fomentar la colaboración.
Te reunirás directamente con el cliente para presentar avances, resolver dudas y entender mejor sus necesidades.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido y salario entre los 28.000 y 32.000 euros brutos/año de entrada, ajustado según tu experiencia (nuestro plan de carrera incluye 2 revisiones anuales). También tendrás a tu disposición un plan de formación especializado, participación en la propiedad y los beneficios de Mática: Wetaca gratuito en la oficina dos días a la semana, horario flexible con facilidades para trabajar desde donde quieras, seguro de salud, retribución flexible con Cobee, además de las vacaciones habituales, ofrecemos una semana extra en Navidad y tres días adicionales en Semana Santa. También recibirás un divertido Welcome Kit con portátil (podrás escoger entre varios modelos Mac o Windows), móvil, botella personalizada, auriculares bluetooth y golosinas.

Cuando estés en nuestra oficina, en el centro de Barcelona o Madrid, la fruta, los cafés y los refrescos corren a cuenta de Mática. ¡Ah! Y si eres amante de los animales, te gustará saber esto: ¡nuestras oficinas son Pet-friendly!




Si te interesa, escríbenos por LinkedIn o envía tu CV a anna.garriga@maticapartners.com




Do you want to be Mática? Be Mática!

  • Comenzarás cada jornada con una reunión diaria de seguimiento de proyecto donde compartirás avances, bloqueos y próximos pasos con el equipo.
  • Tendrás autonomía para organizar tu trabajo, gestionando tus tareas y tiempos de forma flexible, con foco en la entrega de valor y resultados.
  • Participarás en reuniones de equipo semanales para compartir aprendizajes y fomentar la colaboración.
  • Te reunirás directamente con el cliente para presentar avances, resolver dudas y entender mejor sus necesidades.


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Contrato indefinido y salario entre los 28.000 y 32.000 euros brutos/año de entrada, ajustado según tu experiencia (nuestro plan de carrera incluye 2 revisiones anuales). También tendrás a tu disposición un plan de formación especializado, participación en la propiedad y los beneficios de Mática: Wetaca gratuito en la oficina dos días a la semana, horario flexible con facilidades para trabajar desde donde quieras, seguro de salud, retribución flexible con Cobee, además de las vacaciones habituales, ofrecemos una semana extra en Navidad y tres días adicionales en Semana Santa. También recibirás un divertido Welcome Kit con portátil (podrás escoger entre varios modelos Mac o Windows), móvil, botella personalizada, auriculares bluetooth y golosinas.

Cuando estés en nuestra oficina, en el centro de Barcelona o Madrid, la fruta, los cafés y los refrescos corren a cuenta de Mática. ¡Ah! Y si eres amante de los animales, te gustará saber esto: ¡nuestras oficinas son Pet-friendly!


Si te interesa, escríbenos por LinkedIn o envía tu CV a anna.garriga@maticapartners.com


Do you want to be Mática? Be Mática!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📊 About the job




Are you ready to turn raw data into powerful business insights? 📈




Then it's time to join Smart — where innovation meets purpose!

We’re a tech consulting company with over a decade of experience delivering cutting-edge national and international IT & Telecom projects. Now, we’re looking for a Data Analyst with a strong BI background to be part of something big. If you're passionate about data, regulation, and impact — we want to hear from you!




🧠 What do you need to be a SMART DATA ANALYST?

🎓 A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or similar

📌 Solid experience as a Data Analyst, BI Analyst, BI Developer, or equivalent role

📊 Knowledge of data modeling, BI methodologies, and data warehousing (big data context is a plus!)

💬 Ability to talk data in human language — from business users to vendors

🛠️ Tools you know and love:

SQL / HiveQL
Power BI (dashboarding is your playground)
Cognos (just a small part of the job, no worries!)
Experience with Hive or other big data tools
🌍 English fluency (C1 minimum)
🧩 Problem-solver, analytical thinker, and team player
🤝 Strong communication and interpersonal skills




💼 What will you do at SMART?

🌐 Collaborate with business users and local vendors across different countries

🧾 Understand and translate regulatory data needs into actionable specs

📥 Design and implement changes to the data model

🔎 Investigate and resolve complex data issues like a pro

🧪 Create or update SQL queries to deliver the right data at the right time

📊 Modify or build reports (just a bit of Cognos, we promise!)

📈 Help shape a smarter, cleaner, and more insightful BI environment







🌍 Where will you be SMART?

📍 Hybrid model in sunny Porto ☀️




If you're ready to make data matter — and make a real difference in a global financial project — let’s talk.

Be SMART. Be part of something bigger. Be you. 💙

Title: E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst
Description:
Country: Italy

City: Milan, Piazza Einaudi, 4

Contract Type: Regular

Department: E-commerce & Omnichannel

Mode: Hybrid




Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.




Your Opportunity:

The E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst will join the Data Analytics Team, reporting into the Global Ecommerce & Omnichannel Data Science & Business Analytics Manager.

This role is crucial in supporting the business through in-depth and insightful data analysis, generating reports and recommendations for top management and the E-commerce & Omnichannel team.




Your Contribution:

Analyze digital and omnichannel business and digital marketing performance, creating reports and dashboards to share results with a wide range of stakeholders.
Monitor web analytics and KPIs related to the e-Commerce channel to track performance, generate valuable insights, and identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with multiple teams (Merchandising, Media, CRM, Regional teams) to consolidate findings, provide actionable insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Manage and organize work, including collaboration with the digital agencies on the data visualization platforms.
Analyze key business KPIs using Versace's analytics tools (GA4, Adobe Analytics, OBIEE, etc.).
Proactively identify business challenges, develop data-driven solutions, and communicate recommendations effectively.
Leverage data analysis skills to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can inform business strategy and improve performance.
Build and maintain data models and datasets to support reporting and analysis needs.
Analyze large datasets using SQL and similar languages to derive actionable insights and build insightful dashboards and reports.




Your Skills:

2+ years of experience in a similar role within the Fashion & Luxury industry or at a major consulting firm, demonstrating a strong understanding of the business and its unique challenges.
Demonstrated experience working with data as a Data Analyst, including data manipulation, cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
Passion for the fashion and luxury world.
University degree in Business, Management, Digital Marketing, Data Science, or a related field.
Data-oriented mindset with advanced Excel and BI skills. Exceptional analytical skills, accuracy, and attention to detail are essential.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar).
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methods
Experience with SQL.
Excellent written and spoken English (will be tested during the interview process).
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in Versace's diverse and multicultural team.
Team player, highly organized, and flexible, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.




Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are looking for a Middle Data Analyst to join our analytics team. You will help us understand and improve our promo campaigns. If you have experience in iGaming or Betting, know how to use analytics tools, and understand business needs — we would be happy to see you in our team.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience in a casino or betting company (optional: mobile games with P2W model or traffic acquisition);
  • Good skills in SQL, AWS (Athena, S3), Tableau (Desktop and Prep), Excel, and Google Sheets;
  • Experience working with DWH or backend teams, and with product managers;
  • Experience with B2B business models or understanding how they work is a plus;
  • Practical knowledge of Google Analytics and Python;
  • Good communication and organizational skills;
  • Optional: experience in A/B testing;
  • English level: B1


Responsibilities

  • Make reports and analysis for promo campaigns;
  • Work closely with the product analytics team;
  • Organize and lead weekly meetings with promo team managers to show and explain campaign results;
  • Do ad-hoc analysis and create visual reports;
  • Write short and clear documentation in Confluence about your analysis and methods


Benefits

🎰 Be part of the international iGaming industry - Work with a top European solution provider and shape the future of online gaming;

💕 A Collaborative Culture - Join a supportive and understanding team;

💰 Competitive salary and bonus system - Enjoy additional rewards on top of your base salary;

📆 Unlimited vacation & sick leave - Because we prioritize your well-being;

📈 Professional Development - Access a dedicated budget for self-development and learning;

🏥 Healthcare coverage - Available for employees in Ukraine and compensation across the EU;

🫂 Mental health support - Free consultations with a corporate psychologist;

🇬🇧 Language learning support - We cover the cost of foreign language courses;

🎁 Celebrating Your Milestones - Special gifts for life's important moments;

⏳ Flexible working hours - Start your day anytime between 9:00-11:00 AM;

🏢 Flexible Work Arrangements - Choose between remote, office, or hybrid work;

🖥 Modern Tech Setup - Get the tools you need to perform at your best;

🚚 Relocation support - Assistance provided if you move to one of our hubs.

Title: Business Data Analyst (FTC)
Description:
Uniphar - Who We Are

With 3,000+ employees across Ireland, the UK, Europe, MENA, and the U.S., Uniphar partners with 200+ top pharmaco-medical manufacturers, delivering specialised, tech-enabled solutions through its three divisions: Medtech, Supply Chain & Retail, and Pharma.

This opportunity sits within Uniphar Medtech, a dedicated division focused on delivering innovative medical technologies and solutions.

Purpose of the Role

Business Data Analyst, Uniphar Medtech.

Please note this is a fixed term contract role for 11 months.

Uniphar Medtech recognise data as a key business asset.

The data analyst will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, analysing, interpreting and communicating actionable data insights (anomalies, trends, patterns) to commercial and operations teams through reports, visualisations and presentations. The insights will inform and drive business improvement efforts.

The business data analyst will use data extraction, analysis and presentation tools such as Python, Jet Reporting, Jet Analytics, Power BI and AI to deliver on the above responsibilities.

The data analyst will support many business units (BUs) across Medtech.

Key Duties And Responsibilities

This job description is not an exhaustive list but provides an indication of the main duties and responsibilities of the position.


Collaborate with requestors to design, develop and implement data reports and visualizations to communicate data insights to commercial and operations teams with drill down capability by BU (turn raw data into information)
Develop and maintain data reports and visualisations (to include dashboards) to enable self-service by end users (in time)
Generate, monitor and analyse key process and performance metrics (KPIs) to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for business improvement
Collaborate with end users to identify key business questions to help provide actionable insights to support business decision making
Stay up to date with the latest data extraction, analysis (to include AI) and visualization techniques and tools to continuously improve data insights
Support ERP project team with the migration of key reports, metrics and dashboards onto the new ERP system that is planned.
Use of SQL, Python or equivalent to extract, clean and analyse datasets from various data sources



Role Requirements

Essential:


Hold a valid working permit (if applicable)
Full Clean Driving license
Good oral and written communications skills
Good numerical skills
General computer skills
Good organisational skills
Good understanding of health and safety issues
Team player be able to interact with all staff at all levels
Good attention to detail
Good process development and problem-solving skills



Desirable:


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as data analysis, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or economics or proven background in the area of data analysis or similar field
Strong data extraction SQL, Python or other extraction tool skills, with a proven ability to manipulate large datasets
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView, preferably Power BI
Experience with reporting/analysis tools such as Jet Reporting/Jet Analytics
2-3 years of experience in a data analysis role with demonstrated business improvements from data insights communicated
Strong analytical skills with a passion for solving complex problems with data insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations
A passion for improving customer experience and driving business outcomes


Please note we cannot assist with any visa sponsorship and candidates must have the correct visa to live and work in Ireland.

Why work with us

Our core values, titled our Medtech Mindset, guides our culture and work environment:


We Go Forward Together: We operate as a unified team, leveraging diverse specialties to make swift, collaborative decisions and embrace progress over perfection
We Take Our Business Seriously: We prioritise compliance and risk management to ensure the best outcomes for our patients and partners, supported by our innovative portfolio and commitment to sustainability
We Deliver Exceptional Results: We focus on quality, customer satisfaction, and commercial success to achieve outstanding results for our patients, customers, and business


If you have similar values and are passionate about making a meaningful impact, we invite you to join our team and help us drive forward together.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI-expert
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een toonaangevend Belgisch data-intelligencebedrijf met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring in business intelligence en data-analyse. Als trotse Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner beschikken we over diepgaande expertise in Microsoft BI, Data Governance en meer.




Met een team van meer dan 120 gepassioneerde consultants ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun volledige datatraject — van strategie tot implementatie. Wat ons uniek maakt? Onze focus op langetermijnrelaties en een bedrijfscultuur waar plezier en professionaliteit hand in hand gaan.




Door de groei van ons klantenportfolio en nieuwe boeiende projecten zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven Power BI-professional die samen met ons team impactvolle end-to-end dataoplossingen wil realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in (toegepaste) informatica of een verwante richting.
Je hebt een analytische geest en denkt oplossingsgericht.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of een vergelijkbare functie.
Je bent vertrouwd met SQL, DAX en Python.
Je hebt kennis van datamodelleringstechnieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen: je beheerst DAX, datamodellering én custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je …

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory en/of Databricks.
Weet hoe je efficiënt werkt met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Sterk communiceert en graag samenwerkt in teamverband.
Vloeiend bent in zowel Nederlands als Engels.




Ons aanbod

Of je nu werknemer of freelancer bent, wij staan open voor samenwerking.
Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met uitstekende extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfwagen etc.
Je krijgt ruimte voor persoonlijke en professionele groei via opleidingen en certificeringen.
Je werkt aan uitdagende en innovatieve projecten binnen het Microsoft-ecosysteem.
Je wordt deel van een warme en dynamische bedrijfscultuur, met aandacht voor fun: van familiedagen en sportactiviteiten tot onze jaarlijkse skitrip en gezellige spelavonden.




Klaar om jouw carrière naar een hoger niveau te tillen?

Solliciteer vandaag nog en geef je datatalent de ruimte die het verdient.

Ons Talent Acquisition-team kijkt ernaar uit om jou te leren kennen!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Notre client est une entreprise bien établie dans le secteur aéronautique.




Description du poste :

En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez au cœur de la valorisation de la donnée au sein de l’organisation. Vos missions incluront :

Création et maintenance de rapports et dashboards Power BI (visualisations avancées, nouvelles sources de données)
Amélioration continue des rapports existants (pertinence, performance, fiabilité)
Transformation de données issues de sources multiples
Traduction des données en insights accessibles et exploitables pour les équipes métiers
Prise en charge d’analyses ponctuelles (campagnes marketing, performance d’outils internes, etc.)
Interprétation des besoins business en solutions data-driven




Profil recherché :

Bachelier ou master, avec une première expérience dans l’analyse de données
Bonne maîtrise de Power BI
Compétences solides en structuration, traitement et interprétation de données
Bon esprit d’analyse, capacité à vulgariser les résultats complexes
Langues : français, et bonne maîtrise de l’anglais
Esprit collaboratif, orientation solution, autonomie et fiabilité
Show more
HTML:
Notre client est une entreprise bien établie dans le secteur aéronautique.


Description du poste :

En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez au cœur de la valorisation de la donnée au sein de l’organisation. Vos missions incluront :

  • Création et maintenance de rapports et dashboards Power BI (visualisations avancées, nouvelles sources de données)
  • Amélioration continue des rapports existants (pertinence, performance, fiabilité)
  • Transformation de données issues de sources multiples
  • Traduction des données en insights accessibles et exploitables pour les équipes métiers
  • Prise en charge d’analyses ponctuelles (campagnes marketing, performance d’outils internes, etc.)
  • Interprétation des besoins business en solutions data-driven


Profil recherché :

  • Bachelier ou master, avec une première expérience dans l’analyse de données
  • Bonne maîtrise de Power BI
  • Compétences solides en structuration, traitement et interprétation de données
  • Bon esprit d’analyse, capacité à vulgariser les résultats complexes
  • Langues : français, et bonne maîtrise de l’anglais
  • Esprit collaboratif, orientation solution, autonomie et fiabilité

Title: Junior Credit & Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo alla ricerca di un Junior Credit Analyst da inserire nel nostro team: la persona ideale è laureata in Statistica, Economia, Matematica o Informatica e possiede una buona capacità di programmazione.




Il candidato lavorerà all'interno della Direzione Centrale Crediti nel team che si occupa di modelli statistici, processi e strategie finalizzate ad un’efficace gestione del credito.




Requisiti fondamentali saranno un'ottima conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di programmazione tra i seguenti (SAS, Python, R), una buona conoscenza di SQL.




Completano il profilo un'ottima capacità di organizzazione, l'attitudine al problem solving, la capacità di lavorare per obiettivi ed una buona propensione al lavoro in team.




Costituirà titolo preferenziale una pregressa esperienza di massimo 2 anni in società del settore finanziario/consulenza finanziaria/istituti di pagamento e la conoscenza di modelli ML / AI.




Sede di lavoro: Milano.







Per le aziende del Gruppo Mediobanca la diversità e l’inclusività sono valori fondamentali. Le persone interessate verranno considerate nel rispetto della diversità, valorizzando differenti caratteristiche di età, cultura, abilità e orientamento o espressione di genere.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Barcelona (Hybrid)




We’re working with a global organisation at the forefront of innovation in human and animal health. They’re looking for a skilled Data Analyst - Backend to join their growing team in Barcelona. This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a purpose-driven environment where data plays a central role in shaping decisions that impact lives.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement scalable data models, with a focus on star schemas.
Build and maintain data transformation pipelines using DBT.
Work with Snowflake to manage and analyse large datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into actionable data insights.




What We’re Looking For:

Solid experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Strong understanding of data modelling principles.
Proficiency with DBT and Snowflake.
A collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
Ideally based in or near Barcelona.




Why Apply?




This is a chance to join a company that:

Is privately owned and committed to long-term innovation.
Invests heavily in research and development.
Offers a supportive, international work culture with real opportunities for growth and development.




If you're looking to take the next step in your data career with a company that values both people and progress, we’d love to hear from you.




Apply now or get in touch to learn more.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gostamos de resolver problemas e não passamos um dia sem procurar soluções inovadoras. A Ytech é uma start-up tecnológica focada nos setores de IT e Telecomunicações que atua em duas principais áreas: desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e projetos internacionais remotos.




🚀 Ready to join us, Data Analyst?







Tens as skills?

Experiência com Qlik Sense para visualização e modelação de dados.
Bons conhecimentos de Power BI para reporting.
Domínio de SQL, preferencialmente com Teradata.
Conhecimento em processos ETL (PowerCenter valorizado).
Experiência com SAP BO (nice to have).
Experiência em ambientes Agile com Jira.




O que nos torna diferentes

A nossa visão consiste em inovar e reinventar através de serviços tecnológicos, promovendo o sucesso dos nossos parceiros.
A nossa missão é conectar clientes a profissionais altamente especializados e impulsionar negócios.
A nossa cultura é centrada nas pessoas e no seu bem-estar, o que nos permite atrair e reter o melhor de talento.




Junta-te à equipa Ytech! Envia o teu CV para fduarte@ytech.io

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🔵 En CAPITOLE, ¡seguimos creciendo y queremos hacerlo contigo!




👇 Descripción del puesto

Estamos en búsqueda de un/a Data Analyst para unirse a un equipo en plena expansión, con fuerte colaboración con áreas corporativas y foco en el desarrollo de soluciones analíticas de alto impacto para negocio.




🔵 Requisitos:

🔹 Experiencia sólida como analista de datos, con al menos 3 años trabajando con Power BI.

🔹 Capacidad para entender necesidades del negocio, especialmente del área financiera, y traducirlas en informes e indicadores clave (KPIs y métricas).

🔹 Dominio en extracción, limpieza y modelado de datos desde múltiples fuentes, utilizando herramientas como SQL, Python, Power Query y DAX.

🔹 Experiencia en desarrollo e implementación de modelos estadísticos y analítica avanzada.

🔹 Conocimiento y práctica con metodologías ágiles (Scrum).

🔹 Inglés intermedio.




💙 ¿Por qué unirte a nosotros?

📘 1.200€ al año en formación 🚀

🏥 Seguro médico privado gratuito 🩺

🔹 Retribución flexible en transporte, guardería y tickets restaurante 💳

🏋️‍♂️ Acceso a +10K gimnasios por toda España en Wellhub (Gymforless) 💪

🎉 Eventos, team buildings y afterworks cada dos meses 🥳

⚽ Patrocinamos nuestro equipo de fútbol si te animas a jugar ⚡

🔧 Comunidades tecnológicas internas para compartir y crecer juntos 🤓




👉 Sabemos lo importante que es informarte de la empresa, cultura y opiniones de otros profesionales del sector. Por esto, te invitamos a investigar sobre nosotros en:




✨ ¿Quieres saber más? Haz clic here 🖱️ y descubre todos los detalles.

🔍 Descubre lo que dicen sobre nosotros en Glassdoor Reviews 🕵️‍♀️

🎥 ¿Te gustaría conocer más sobre nuestra cultura? Mira este video 👉 YouTube




¿Te animas a este gran reto y equipo? 🚀




Empowering People, Unlocking Innovation




El empleado se adherirá a las políticas de seguridad de la información:

Tendrá acceso a información confidencial relacionada con Capitole y el proyecto en el que está trabajando.
Deberá cumplir con las políticas de seguridad y las pautas internas de la empresa y del cliente.
Se le requerirá firmar un NDA.

Title: Data Analyst (m|w|d)
Description:
About

Strategy& ist die globale Strategieberatung von PwC. Wir entwickeln individuelle Geschäftsstrategien für weltweit führende Unternehmen, basierend auf differenzierenden Wettbewerbsfähigkeiten. Wir sind die einzige Strategieberatung als Teil eines globalen Professional Services Netzwerks. Unsere Expertise kombinieren wir mit Technologie und erarbeiten daraus eine passende Strategie, die effizient umsetzbar ist. „Strategy, made real“ heißt für uns, den digitalen Wandel voranzutreiben, die Zukunft mitzugestalten und Visionen Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen. 3.000 Strategieberater:innen und mehr als 364.000 PwC-Mitarbeiter:innen in 151 Ländern tragen hierzu mit hochwertigen, branchenspezifischen Dienstleistungen in den Bereichen Wirtschaftsprüfung, Steuer- und Unternehmensberatung bei.

Als Creative Design Expert (w/m/d) am Standort München, bist du ein integraler Bestandteil unseres Visual Communications Services (VCS) und Marketing-Teams. Deine Aufgabe ist es, qualitativ hochwertige Grafikdienstleistungen für eine international tätige Strategieberatung zu entwickeln. Zu deinen wesentlichen Verantwortlichkeiten zählen die Weiterentwicklung unserer kreativen Vision und Corporate Identity, die eigenständige Leitung von Projekten sowie die Steuerung externer Designteams. Du arbeitest eng mit Berater:innen zusammen, förderst visuelle Innovationen durch die Nutzung neuer Technologien auf digitalen Unternehmenskanälen und optimierst Prozesse und Effizienzen, um den Markenauftritt von Strategy& zu stärken. Du bist ein:e visionäre:r Designer:in mit einer ausgeprägten Leidenschaft für Kreativität und einem besonderen Talent im Projektmanagement.

Strategy& ist die globale Strategieberatung von PwC. Wir entwickeln individuelle Geschäftsstrategien für weltweit führende Unternehmen, basierend auf differenzierenden Wettbewerbsfähigkeiten. Wir sind die einzige Strategieberatung als Teil eines globalen Professional Services Netzwerks. Unsere Expertise kombinieren wir mit Technologie und erarbeiten daraus eine passende Strategie, die effizient umsetzbar ist. „Strategy, made real“ heißt für uns, den digitalen Wandel voranzutreiben, die Zukunft mitzugestalten und Visionen Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen. 3.000 Strategieberater:innen und mehr als 364.000 PwC-Mitarbeiter:innen in 151 Ländern tragen hierzu mit hochwertigen, branchenspezifischen Dienstleistungen in den Bereichen Wirtschaftsprüfung, Steuer- und Unternehmensberatung bei.

In der Rolle des Data Analyst (m|w|d) am Standort Düsseldorf oder Frankfurt a.M. unterstützt du unsere Projekte durch die Analyse und Aufbereitung von Daten. Dabei programmierst du datenbankgestützte Analyse-Tools und erstellst eigenständig Reporting-Anwendungen. Zudem umfassen deine Aufgaben die Entwicklung nutzerfreundlicher Business-Intelligence-Lösungen und die Automatisierung datengetriebener Prozesse. Du arbeitest technologieübergreifend und wählst die Software, die am besten zu den Kundenanforderungen passt und trägst mit deinem Know-how maßgeblich zum Projekterfolg bei.

Datenanalyse und -aufbereitung: Durchführung komplexer Datenanalysen zur Unterstützung von Projektentscheidungen, einschließlich der Aufbereitung und Visualisierung von Daten für unterschiedliche Stakeholder.

Programmierung und Entwicklung von Analyse-Tools: Entwicklung und Pflege datenbankgestützter Analyse-Tools und Reporting-Anwendungen.

Business-Intelligence-Lösungen: Erstellung nutzerfreundlicher BI-Lösungen, die es den Kunden ermöglichen, datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und ihre Geschäftsprozesse effizienter zu gestalten.

Automatisierung und Prozessoptimierung: Schreiben von Programmen zur Automatisierung datengetriebener Prozesse, um die Effizienz zu steigern und manuelle Arbeitsaufwände zu reduzieren.

Ausbildung/Studium: Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes technisches Hochschulstudium oder vergleichbare relevante Ausbildung mit mindestens zwei Jahren Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics, IT, Software.

Softwarekenntnisse: Relevante Kenntnisse in mindestens einer der Programmiersprachen VBA oder Python, umfassende Erfahrungen in MS-Power BI oder Tableau, exzellente Kennnisse in MS-Office, insbesondere Excel. Erfahrungen mit den folgenden Technologien sind von Vorteil: SQL, Gitlab, Frontend-Entwicklung mit Javascript / React, xlwings.

Kommunikationsstil: Dich zeichnet eine sehr große Kommunikationsstärke in deutscher als auch englischer Sprache aus. Du bist ein Teamplayer und bringst lösungsorientiertes Arbeiten mit starker Durchsetzungs- und Umsetzungsfähigkeit mit.


Offsite-Events: Bei uns gibt es viele Gelegenheiten, gemeinsame Erfolge zu feiern. Zum Beispiel im Rahmen von Projekt-Team-Events, bei unseren jährlichen Sommer- und Weihnachtsfeiern oder dem internationalen Strategy& Soccer Cup.   
Top-Strategieberatung: Wir leben eine Kultur des starken Zusammenhalts und der familiären Atmosphäre. Das spiegelt sich in den Rankings wie Vault oder Bewertungen auf Kununu wieder.  
Hohes Maß an Flexibilität: Im Rahmen eines Flex Work Programms hast du in Absprache mit deinem Team die Möglichkeit, deine Arbeitszeit- und -ort variabel zu gestalten.  
Weitere Benefits: Bei Strategy& genießt du je nach aktuell gültigem Benefit-Programm zahlreiche Vorteile aus dem PwC-Netzwerk und viele Vergünstigungen im Online- und Einzelhandel.

Tableau

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🔵 ¡En Capitole seguimos creciendo y queremos hacerlo contigo! 🚀




🔎 Estamos buscando un perfil Data Analyst. Tu objetivo será el de participar dentro del área de Data a analizar y resolver problemas, traducir las necesidades de negocio de las áreas de nuestro cliente.




🤖EXPERIENCIA TECNICA:

- Al menos 2 años en roles analíticos (Data analyst, BI, Analytics Engineer)

- Dominio de SQL (consultas complejas y optimización)

- Experiencia con herramientas de visualización (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik)

- Experiencia en modelado de datos (ETL) y arquitectura cloud (Azure)

- Conocimiento de Python




📍Ubicación: Hibrido en El Prat de Llobregat

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What To Expect
Tesla is looking to hire an enthusiastic and experienced Analyst to support our business in EMEA. Business Analytics team is focused on building the reporting necessary to measure key performance indicators for Tesla’s sales, delivery and service teams, and increasing efficiency through data and analytics.

You will be tasked to provide proactive analyses helping to drive business programs and informed decisions. The Data Analyst should act as an advisor, ultimately helping leadership to identify and overcome challenges thereby helping to enhance the productivity of Tesla’s sales, delivery and service organization. The Analyst must be able to clearly communicate insights to the management teams. You will have the opportunity to develop and continuously improve the way we make decision based on data.

What You'll Do


Develop and implement detailed and accurate reports for the management team, providing visibility into performance against key business objective
Manipulate and interpret large datasets to deliver actionable insights to the management
Design intuitive and elegant visualizations to communicate key insights that drive business decisions
Improve the sales, delivery and service organization’s access to data via improved data generation and processing by partnering with our system analysts teams
Develop new tools to promote productivity and efficiency utilizing Tableau, SQL, Python and Tesla in-house reporting tools
Communicate effectively with the regional managers to identify and address areas for improvement
Build and maintain advanced models to measure, analyze, and forecast key metrics for our business in EMEA



What You'll Bring


Highly collaborative and team-oriented, while also able to work independently
Ability to deliver under tight deadlines and work on multiple tasks and projects at once
Experience with Tableau (or similar tooling like MS PowerBI, Qlik), SQL, and Microsoft Excel. Experience with Python and/or R is a plus
Excellent quantitative skills and a deep understanding of statistical methods with an ability to inspire confidence in data-driven decision making
Strong written and verbal communication skill



, Tesla

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst (Consulente BI)




🌍 Per la sede di Treviso oppure di Belluno

📍 Ruolo ibrido: 4 giorni a settimana in sede / 1 giorno di "smart working"




Per un un’importante Cliente specializzato in soluzioni software per la gestione aziendale, stiamo cercando un/a Data Analyst Junior.




Panoramica del ruolo:

Entrerai a far parte del team tecnico e sarai coinvolto/a nei progetti legati allo sviluppo del prodotto, seguendo l’intero ciclo di realizzazione delle funzionalità destinate al cliente.




Responsabilità:

Attività di consulenza nella fase di prevendita, valutando le esigenze del cliente e proponendo la soluzione più adatta.
Collaborazione con il team tecnico nella messa in opera e nella personalizzazione delle soluzioni concordate con il cliente.
Realizzazione e adattamento delle componenti del prodotto in base alle specifiche funzionali condivise.
Guida del cliente nell’adozione del sistema, fornendo il necessario supporto formativo per un utilizzo efficace.
Assistenza post-implementazione, occupandosi della risoluzione di problemi e richieste tramite il servizio di supporto tecnico.




Requisiti richiesti:

Interesse per l’ambito della Data Analysis e motivazione ad approfondire strumenti e metodologie del settore.
Familiarità iniziale con Power BI di Microsoft e comprensione dei principi

fondamentali delle soluzioni di Business Intelligence.

Capacità di problem solving.
Forte orientamento al lavoro collaborativo e buone capacità relazionali.




Requisiti preferenziali:

Esperienza nell’interrogazione e gestione di basi dati attraverso linguaggi SQL.
Familiarità con strumenti dedicati all’estrazione, trasformazione e caricamento dei dati (ETL).







ID posizione: 230525

Categoria: IT, Sviluppo, Consulenza.

Sede: Treviso / Belluno, Veneto, Italia.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise

With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.







Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems







In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Data Analyst.




MAIN TASKS:

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder’s decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development.
Database Management (SQL).
Methodologies (Agile).
Office Pack (MS Excel).
Power BI / Tableau.
Fluency in English is required.
Practice in French (Desirable).




📍Hybrid Model at the Porto office.




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
5 Degrés Toulouse est une agence de conseil à taille humaine spécialisée dans le produit digital. Basés à Toulouse depuis trois ans, nous accompagnons nos clients de divers secteurs d'activités (santé, aéronautique, automobile, grande distribution) à la fois en BtoB et BtoC. Organisés en cinq practices, nous couvrons intégralement la chaîne de création d'un produit digital : Product Management, Product Design, Product Development, Product Quality et Product Data.




Notre ambition : devenir un acteur incontournable du Produit en Occitanie et au-delà, en aidant nos clients à transformer leurs organisations et à gagner en maturité produit 🚀.

Pour ce faire, nous recherchons un.e Data Analyst avec au minimum 4 ans d'expérience pour rejoindre notre practice Product Data et intervenir chez nos clients.




Descriptif du poste :




En tant que Data Analyst, vous savez :




Accompagner le métier dans la définition de leurs besoins
Collecter, nettoyer et modéliser les données
Créer et paramétrer des tableaux de bord/rapports mis à disposition pour les métiers
Être force de proposition sur l’amélioration des bonnes pratiques de l’équipe
Challenger la qualité des données tout au long de leur traitement
Partager vos connaissances et renforcer la cohésion d’équipe




Profil recherché :




Au moins 4 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Analyst
Maîtrise de SQL
Maîtrise d’un ou plusieurs outils de Data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik ou encore Microstrategy)
Pratique d’un outil ETL (Talend, SSIS, Informatica ou encore Datastage)
Connaissances en bases de données (ex SQL Server ou MySQL) et NoSQL.
Bonnes aptitudes en communication/vulgarisation de son travail et capacité à travailler en équipe




Déroulement des entretiens :




Un entretien avec un(e) RH pour en apprendre plus sur 5 Degrés (1h).
Un entretien avec un(e) Business Manager pour en apprendre plus sur les projets clients (45 min)
Un entretien avec le Practice Leader ou un membre de la practice pour parler métier et se projeter dans la Practice (1h).
Un entretien avec le Directeur Associé pour un échange global autour de 5 Degrés et de ses valeurs (30 min).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
💚Softtek es un socio global de ingeniería de software que impulsa el progreso de las compañías. Desde hace más de 40 años, hemos ayudado a nuestros clientes a desarrollar, implementar y gestionar tecnología que mejora la vida de las personas.

Con presencia en más de 20 países y más de 16,000 softtekians en todo el mundo, en Softtek estamos en constante crecimiento. En España, te ofrecemos la oportunidad de unirte a nuestra comunidad en ubicaciones como Albacete, Asturias, Ávila, Barcelona, Córdoba, Coruña, Madrid, Narón, Segovia o Zaragoza, donde podrás desarrollar tu carrera dentro de un modelo híbrido y flexible.

En 2024, hemos sido reconocidos en la Lista Forbes como una de las 100 mejores empresas para trabajar en España, destacando por nuestra flexibilidad y personalización en la experiencia del empleado. Creemos en el poder de las habilidades diversas y la la iniciativa personal para lograr cosas asombrosas, y valoramos el talento único de cada persona para contribuir al crecimiento y diversidad de nuestro equipo. ¿Nos acompañas en esta aventura? #FutureTogether




🔎¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un Data Analyst con experiencia para liderar y gestionar todos los aspectos del ciclo de vida de un proyecto de datos. Esto incluye:

Configuración del flujo de trabajo
Acordar los diseños de las soluciones

Planificación e informes de progreso




💻 ¿Cómo será tu día a día?

El objetivo será agilizar los procesos de presentación de informes mediante:

Centralización de las actividades de los paquetes de informes
Reducción del número de informes
Garantizar la coherencia de los mensajes
Incorporación de tecnologías de Power BI e IA para mejorar:
Visualización de datos
Análisis de datos
Capacidades de automatización




✅ Conoce nuestra propuesta de valor

📝 Contrato indefinido.

💻Modelo híbrido: Súmate a nuestro modelo Softtek 56, que se adapta a las circunstancias de cada Softtekian y en donde podrás conectar y desarrollarte con nuestros equipos en las diferentes sedes 56 horas al mes y disfruta de teletrabajo el resto del tiempo.

👪 Conciliación: Horario flexible y el programa BetterWork que apoya el equilibrio entre tu vida personal y profesional.

✈️24 días de vacaciones.

🩺 Seguro médico.

💳Retribución flexible: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería o seguro médico familiares.

🎂 Tarde de cumpleaños libre (también por el cumple de tus hijos).

🎁 Club del empleado: Beneficios y promociones exclusivas por ser Softtekian.

🎓Planes de formación: idiomas, tecnologías y habilidades interpersonales.

🌍 Oportunidad de movilidad interna: en nuestras sedes internacionales y dentro de España.
