Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¿Te apasiona el BigData? ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo con una de las trayectorias más solventes en el mundo del Machine Learning, Analytics y BigData? ¿Te apetece trabajar en una compañía joven, participativa y especializada?




Para ello solo exigimos un requisito, que tus respuestas a las preguntas anteriores hayan sido: ¡SÍ!

En Daus Data, trabajamos continuamente para mantenernos a la vanguardia tecnológica, y además somos una empresa People Centric, ponemos al trabajador en el centro de todo lo que hacemos. Creemos en una cultura horizontal, sin egos, en un entorno donde se valoran tanto las ideas como las personas.




Buscamos a un/a Data Analyst con 2 años de experiencia en análisis de datos para generar insights accionables y apoyar la toma de decisiones basada en data.




¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia en Tableau en entornos reales.
Experiencia demostrada en SQL.
Alto nivel de inglés. Te integrarás en un equipo internacional y tu nivel de inglés debe ser alto, tanto escrito como hablado.
Valorable experiencia en PowerBI, Looker.
Valorable experiencia con AWS.
Valoraremos experiencia realizando procesos ETL.
Se valorará conocimientos de Python.




¿Cómo será tu día a día?




Comenzarás cada jornada con una reunión diaria de seguimiento de proyecto donde compartirás avances, bloqueos y próximos pasos con el equipo.
Tendrás autonomía para organizar tu trabajo, gestionando tus tareas y tiempos de forma flexible, con foco en la entrega de valor y resultados.
Participarás en reuniones de equipo semanales para compartir aprendizajes y fomentar la colaboración.
Te reunirás directamente con el cliente para presentar avances, resolver dudas y entender mejor sus necesidades.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido y salario entre los 28.000 y 32.000 euros brutos/año de entrada, ajustado según tu experiencia (nuestro plan de carrera incluye 2 revisiones anuales). También tendrás a tu disposición un plan de formación especializado, participación en la propiedad y los beneficios de Mática: Wetaca gratuito en la oficina dos días a la semana, horario flexible con facilidades para trabajar desde donde quieras, seguro de salud, retribución flexible con Cobee, además de las vacaciones habituales, ofrecemos una semana extra en Navidad y tres días adicionales en Semana Santa. También recibirás un divertido Welcome Kit con portátil (podrás escoger entre varios modelos Mac o Windows), móvil, botella personalizada, auriculares bluetooth y golosinas.

Cuando estés en nuestra oficina, en el centro de Barcelona o Madrid, la fruta, los cafés y los refrescos corren a cuenta de Mática. ¡Ah! Y si eres amante de los animales, te gustará saber esto: ¡nuestras oficinas son Pet-friendly!




Si te interesa, escríbenos por LinkedIn o envía tu CV a anna.garriga@maticapartners.com




Do you want to be Mática? Be Mática!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
💚Softtek es un socio global de ingeniería de software que impulsa el progreso de las compañías. Desde hace más de 40 años, hemos ayudado a nuestros clientes a desarrollar, implementar y gestionar tecnología que mejora la vida de las personas.

Con presencia en más de 20 países y más de 16,000 softtekians en todo el mundo, en Softtek estamos en constante crecimiento. En España, te ofrecemos la oportunidad de unirte a nuestra comunidad en ubicaciones como Albacete, Asturias, Ávila, Barcelona, Córdoba, Coruña, Madrid, Narón, Segovia o Zaragoza, donde podrás desarrollar tu carrera dentro de un modelo híbrido y flexible.

En 2024, hemos sido reconocidos en la Lista Forbes como una de las 100 mejores empresas para trabajar en España, destacando por nuestra flexibilidad y personalización en la experiencia del empleado. Creemos en el poder de las habilidades diversas y la la iniciativa personal para lograr cosas asombrosas, y valoramos el talento único de cada persona para contribuir al crecimiento y diversidad de nuestro equipo. ¿Nos acompañas en esta aventura? #FutureTogether




🔎¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un Data Analyst con experiencia para liderar y gestionar todos los aspectos del ciclo de vida de un proyecto de datos. Esto incluye:

Configuración del flujo de trabajo
Acordar los diseños de las soluciones

Planificación e informes de progreso




💻 ¿Cómo será tu día a día?

El objetivo será agilizar los procesos de presentación de informes mediante:

Centralización de las actividades de los paquetes de informes
Reducción del número de informes
Garantizar la coherencia de los mensajes
Incorporación de tecnologías de Power BI e IA para mejorar:
Visualización de datos
Análisis de datos
Capacidades de automatización




✅ Conoce nuestra propuesta de valor

📝 Contrato indefinido.

💻Modelo híbrido: Súmate a nuestro modelo Softtek 56, que se adapta a las circunstancias de cada Softtekian y en donde podrás conectar y desarrollarte con nuestros equipos en las diferentes sedes 56 horas al mes y disfruta de teletrabajo el resto del tiempo.

👪 Conciliación: Horario flexible y el programa BetterWork que apoya el equilibrio entre tu vida personal y profesional.

✈️24 días de vacaciones.

🩺 Seguro médico.

💳Retribución flexible: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería o seguro médico familiares.

🎂 Tarde de cumpleaños libre (también por el cumple de tus hijos).

🎁 Club del empleado: Beneficios y promociones exclusivas por ser Softtekian.

🎓Planes de formación: idiomas, tecnologías y habilidades interpersonales.

🌍 Oportunidad de movilidad interna: en nuestras sedes internacionales y dentro de España.

Modelo híbrido: Súmate a nuestro modelo Softtek 56, que se adaptada a las circunstancias de cada Softtekian y en donde podrás conectar y desarrollarte con nuestros equipos en las diferentes sedes 56 horas al mes y disfruta de teletrabajo el resto del tiempo.

👪 Conciliación: Horario flexible y el programa BetterWork que apoya el equilibrio entre tu vida personal y profesional.

✈️24 días de vacaciones

🩺 Seguro médico

💳 Retribución flexible: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería o seguro médico familiares.

🎂 Tarde de cumpleaños libre (también por el cumple de tus hijos)

🎁 Club del empleado: Beneficios y promociones exclusivas por ser Softtekian.

🎓 Planes de formación: idiomas, tecnologías y habilidades interpersonales.

🌍 Oportunidad de movilidad interna: en nuestras sedes internacionales y dentro de España.

🔝 Valoraremos especialmente la candidatura de personas que posean habilidades y capacidades únicas y diversas, reconociendo la importancia de facilitar su integración plena en el mercado laboral. Cada individuo, con sus capacidades singulares, aporta una riqueza invaluable a nuestra comunidad, y nuestro compromiso es asegurar que todos tengan la oportunidad de demostrar su valía y contribuir al crecimiento y la diversidad de nuestro equipo.




👀 ¡Estamos deseando conocerte!

Beneficios y promociones exclusivas por ser parte de Softtek.

🔝 Valoraremos especialmente la candidatura de personas que posean habilidades y capacidades únicas y diversas, reconociendo la importancia de facilitar su integración plena en el mercado laboral. Cada individuo, con sus capacidades singulares, aporta una riqueza invaluable a nuestra comunidad, y nuestro compromiso es asegurar que todos tengan la oportunidad de demostrar su valía y contribuir al crecimiento y la diversidad de nuestro equipo.


👀 ¡Estamos deseando conocerte!

Beneficios y promociones exclusivas por ser parte de Softtek.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Inetum es líder europeo en servicios digitales. El equipo de 28.000 consultores y expertos de Inetum se esfuerza cada día por lograr un impacto digital en las empresas, en las entidades del sector público y en la sociedad. Las soluciones de Inetum quieren contribuir al rendimiento y la innovación de sus clientes, así como al interés general. Presente en 19 países con una red de centros densa, Inetum colabora con los principales fabricantes de software para afrontar los retos de la transformación digital con proximidad y flexibilidad. Impulsada por su ambición de crecimiento y expansión, Inetum generó una cifra de negocio de 2.500 millones de euros en 2023.







🎯 ¡Únete a INETUM como Data Analyst! 🎯

Si tienes más de 4 años de experiencia en diseño e implementación de controles, esta oferta es para ti. Únete a un equipo donde la calidad y la seguridad de los datos son clave para la toma de decisiones estratégicas.




🔹 Responsabilidades:

Diseñar e implementar controles de datos eficaces.
Apoyar las pruebas UAT para validar su correcta implementación.
Garantizar que los controles cumplen con los estándares exigidos.
Mantener actualizada la documentación de controles.




🔹 Requisitos obligatorios:

Conocimientos intermedios en datos estructurados, bases de datos relacionales y herramientas de repositorio y metadatos.
Habilidades intermedias en SQL para análisis y gestión de datos.
Capacidad para colaborar con stakeholders en la identificación de riesgos y diseño de controles adecuados.
Experiencia en documentación de procesos, cumpliendo normativas como SoX.
Habilidad para identificar problemas de calidad de datos, analizar causas raíz y evaluar el impacto en el negocio.
Comunicación efectiva con distintos niveles, desde reuniones de proyecto hasta revisiones estratégicas de datos.
Capacidad para crear reportes de control y resultados para la gestión ejecutiva.
Interpretación y comunicación de información técnica de manera comprensible para stakeholders no técnicos.




🚨 Nivel de inglés avanzado (C1 o superior) obligatorio. Candidaturas sin este nivel no serán consideradas.




🔹 Valorable:

Selección de herramientas y técnicas para garantizar calidad de datos en procesos y flujos de negocio.
Conocimiento de políticas internas aplicables a gestión de datos (Data Management & Data Governance).




🔹 Perfil:

🎓 Grado universitario en disciplinas STEM.

👥 Años de experiencia: 4+.




NOTA: Posibilidad de trabajo en remoto SOLO candidaturas ubicadas en España.




💡¿QUÉ PODEMOS OFRECERTE?:

Retribución salarial acorde con la experiencia aportada
Plan de carrera: ofrecemos una atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con un sólido crecimiento
Plan de formación en competencias tecnológicas de acuerdo con las exigencias de los proyectos y clientes.
Retribución flexible: te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos y modelar tú mismo cómo distribuirlos: seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, tarjeta transporte, etc.
Flexibilidad horaria




Si cumples con los requisitos y quieres formar parte de un equipo dinámico, envíanos tu candidatura. CV en Inglés, necesario. ¡Te esperamos!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID

211928

Posted

30-Apr-2025

Service line

Advisory Segment

Role type

Part-time

Areas of Interest

Data & Analytics

Location(s)

Copenhagen - Hovedstaden - Denmark

Are you looking for a student job in data analytics and do you have an interest for the real estate market? Then this is a unique opportunity to combine your analytical skills with a substantive function in a commercial environment!

What will you be doing?

The real estate market is undergoing a significant and exciting change – driven by data and technology. The main focus of this position will be to support the team in leveraging our product portfolio and developing new data driven solutions to address new business challenges of our clients. The role will establish a profound relationship with the regional and EMEA research teams.

Your Key Responsibilities


Support the automation of manual tasks and reports by making intelligent use of available analytics and data visualization
Review and evaluate collected data and secure data quality, consistency, accuracy and comprehensiveness
Liaise with EMEA and Local CBRE research team to collaborate and implement new solutions
Contribute to the broader rollout of the Core Enablement Platform in collaboration with the Digital & Technology and Customer Success teams


Who are you?

We are looking for a committed, ambitious and independent student who has a great sense of responsibility for tasks and deadlines. You should be detail oriented with strong analytical skills and have a positive, innovative and opportunistic mindset. You must thrive in an international environment and an informal tone, where it is crucial that you speak and write English at a high level.

Preferably you are studying a bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, data analytics, business intelligence or related disciplines.

Qualifications

Other qualifications we are looking for (you do not have to tick all the boxes to be the right match for the position):


You have experience in an analytically oriented, data, or quantitative role
You have programming experience in Python or R and respective data analysis libraries
You have basic knowledge of some of the following technologies: Alteryx, SQL and relational database concepts, and an intrinsic motivation to develop these skills
You have basic knowledge of reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI and enjoy converting data into valuable insights
You have strong numerical skills including the ability to handle and manipulate large amounts of numerical data into clearly defined outputs based on a project driven approach.
You'll take ownership of data quality, including performing manual data entry tasks as needed to ensure our end users have reliable information. You recognize that consistent data maintenance is key to driving successful data analysis
You have an excellent understanding of the English language but can also communicate in Danish


About Us

CBRE is the world’s largest commercial real estate services with more than 100,000 employees worldwide. We are present in more than 100+ countries in more than 500 offices and work with every corner of the real estate market. CBRE's international angle, specialization and more than 100 years of experience guarantee a market insight with the highest standards.

We have a flexible working environment with excellent development opportunities in a dynamic and diverse organization.

What Can We Offer


A team consisting of both young ambitious and experienced employees
Assignments with great variety and a steep learning curve with challenges and growing responsibilities
Flexible working hours 15-25 hours per week
A good work and student environment
Attractive employee benefits


Next Step

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and please note that virtual interviews are part of this recruiting process. We are looking forward to hearing from you.

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Senior Analyst, D&T Lead, Htet Aung, on email: htet.aung@cbre.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!




Somos una empresa estratégica internacional de servicios tecnológicos, comprometida esencialmente con su equipo y con la sociedad. Ofrecemos soluciones en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, de electrónica, y proyectos de I+D. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades, promoviendo su desarrollo profesional y personal.




Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst Medior con experiencia en entornos de Business Intelligence sobre Azure para participar en un proyecto de visualización y análisis de datos estratégicos, dentro de un entorno cloud moderno.




Responsabilidades




Analizar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes en entornos cloud.
Desarrollar dashboards y reportes en Power BI Premium.
Crear modelos analíticos en Azure Analysis Services.
Desarrollar y mantener consultas SQL optimizadas.
Colaborar con equipos de producto y negocio para transformar datos en insights.




Requisitos




+3 años de experiencia como Data Analyst.
Dominio de Power BI, SQL, y Azure Analysis Services.
Conocimiento de herramientas como Visual Studio y GitHub.
Experiencia en proyectos de Business Intelligence.
Inglés fluido.




Además, en K-LAGAN queremos que disfrutes de la experiencia completa de ser parte de nuestro equipo, por ello ofrecemos:




✅ Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable

🏢 Modalidad: Híbrido en Barcelona (2 días en oficina - 3 desde casa)

📈 Seguimiento técnico y acompañamiento

🎓 Formación continua

🎂 Día libre en tu cumpleaños

🎉 Eventos, team buildings y más




Si te apasiona dar sentido a los datos y ayudar a tomar decisiones estratégicas con ellos, ¡este proyecto es para ti! 🚀




¡Aplica ahora y hagamos que los datos cuenten!

Title: Analista de Datos
Company: LIS Data Solutions ES | Technological Consulting
Place: Santa Cruz de Bezana, Cantabria, Spain
Description:
¡Hola! Somos LIS Data Solutions, una ingeniería especializada en el análisis de datos. Ayudamos a las empresas a transformar y hacer crecer su negocio con soluciones innovadoras en Industria 4.0, Big Data e Inteligencia Artificial.




💡Creemos firmemente que el motor de la innovación son las personas. Por eso, hemos desarrollado una cultura centrada en el talento, el bienestar y el crecimiento profesional. Este compromiso nos llevó a ser reconocidos en 2022 con el Premio a la Calidad en el Empleo en Cantabria.




🚀Somos una empresa joven y en expansión , con presencia en Álava, Cantabria, Barcelona, Hamburgo y Ulm (Alemania). Y esto… ¡es solo el principio! Estamos buscando ANALISTAS DE DATOS para trabajar en nuestra oficina de Santa Cruz de Bezana desarrollando proyectos a medida en el sector del análisis de datos y la Inteligencia Artificial.




🛠️ ¿Qué harás en LIS?

Colaborarás con el equipo de proyectos en el diseño y desarrollo de soluciones personalizadas basadas en datos.
Construirás plataformas para el tratamiento y almacenamiento de datos, integrándolas con sistemas de bases de datos y asegurando su escalabilidad y alto rendimiento.
Participarás en el desarrollo de scripts de extracción, procesamiento y almacenamiento de datos utilizando Python y Pandas.
Crearás dashboards que faciliten la visualización clara y eficaz de los datos.
Contribuirás a las tareas de testing para garantizar que nuestras soluciones cumplan con los más altos estándares de calidad.




¿Qué valoramos de ti?

🔹 Imprescindible:

Programación: experiencia con Python, especialmente utilizando librerías como NumPy y Pandas.
Bases de datos: conocimiento sólido de SQL y experiencia con SQL Server o PostgreSQL.
Business Intelligence / Visualización: dominio de Power BI. Valorando experiencia con otras herramientas como Qlik Sense o Tableau.




🔸 Muy valorable:

Titulaciones técnicas en áreas como Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas, Física o Ingenierías afines.
1-2 años de experiencia demostrable en proyectos relacionados con el análisis de datos, desarrollo de soluciones en Python o herramientas de visualización.
Experiencia en tratamiento de datos en la nube y entornos Big Data, como Azure Blob Storage, Databricks o PySpark.
Conocimientos en Análisis Avanzado de Datos, Machine Learning o Deep Learning, utilizando librerías como Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch o Azure ML.




✔️ A tener en cuenta:

Actitud proactiva, compromiso con los objetivos y flexibilidad ante nuevos retos.
Familiaridad con Git u otros sistemas de control de versiones.
Capacidad para analizar, depurar y resolver problemas técnicos de forma eficiente.
Buenas habilidades para la resolución de problemas.
Excelentes capacidades de organización, comunicación y trabajo en equipo.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido a jornada completa.
Plan de carrera personalizado y estable.
Programa de formación y aprendizaje continuo.
Buen ambiente dentro y fuera de la oficina: disfrutarás de varios teambuildings al año, actividades deportivas y mucho más.
Flexibilidad horaria y jornada intensiva los viernes, en verano y Navidad.
23 días hábiles de vacaciones.
Gimnasio gratuito.




✨Si buscas un entorno dinámico, con proyectos retadores y oportunidades reales de crecimiento... ¡Este es tu sitio!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
HubSpot is looking for a Data Analyst to support HubSpot’s Sales Development organization. The Sales Strategy mission at HubSpot is to enable data-driven decisions that drive growth and productivity. This role will work directly with the sales leaders of these teams to define the go-to-market strategy and help develop a world-class outbound strategy.

You will report to a Sales Strategy Senior Manager and help define strategic choices, planning, reporting, and GTM programs to improve front-line productivity and establish an efficient operating model for the sales strategy team. This work will focus on designing and executing strategic sales initiatives and providing operational systems, and analytical support for Global Sales Development.

In This Role, You Will


Provide data-driven operational and decision-making support to the Sales Development organization and management team.
Maintain the staffing and capacity for the Sales Development organization and partner with central planning teams to deliver our headcount plan.
Liaise with leadership to monitor KPIs and identify trends and opportunities to maximize impact.
Respond to business requests, perform root-cause analyses, and provide recommendations to solve problems and capture opportunities.
Support cross-functional programs, tools, processes, and systems to drive performance and productivity improvements.


We Are Looking For People Who


Are process-oriented and excel at creating and executing a clear operating cadence across a range of stakeholders.
Are highly analytical and can leverage raw, unorganized data into actionable insights and repeatable, scalable reporting.
Can adapt quickly to the evolving needs of a high-growth SaaS business and create pragmatic and innovative solutions to complex business problems.
Are comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment and interacting with senior stakeholders from various business functions.
Are driven to define the right metrics and analysis to produce actionable insights.
Proven SQL knowledge and experience.
Have 2+ years of professional experience.
Have B.A. or B.S. degree (An M.B.A. is a plus).


Role

Skills

HubSpot judges candidates on potential, not a list of skills. Folks that we’ve hired in the past include the following profiles:


Analytical Management Consultants with a mix of strategic and operational experience.
Sales Ops, Customer Ops, and FP&A professionals.
Technical folks with a passion for solving business problems.


We know the confidence gap and impostor syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form. This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.

At HubSpot, we value both flexibility and connection. Whether you’re a Remote employee or work from the Office, we want you to start your journey here by building strong connections with your team and peers. If you are joining our Engineering team, you will be required to attend a regional HubSpot office for in-person onboarding. If you join our broader Product team, you’ll also attend other in-person events such as your Product Group Summit and other gatherings to continue building on those connections.

If you require an accommodation due to travel limitations or other reasons, please inform your recruiter during the hiring process. We are committed to supporting candidates who may need alternative arrangements

Massachusetts Applicants: It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Germany Applicants: (m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page here.

India Applicants: link to HubSpot India's equal opportunity policy here.

About HubSpot

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022 and has been recognized for its award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees across the globe work remotely and in HubSpot offices. Visit our careers website to learn more about the culture and opportunities at HubSpot.

By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.
Show more
HTML:
HubSpot is looking for a Data Analyst to support HubSpot’s Sales Development organization. The Sales Strategy mission at HubSpot is to enable data-driven decisions that drive growth and productivity. This role will work directly with the sales leaders of these teams to define the go-to-market strategy and help develop a world-class outbound strategy.

You will report to a Sales Strategy Senior Manager and help define strategic choices, planning, reporting, and GTM programs to improve front-line productivity and establish an efficient operating model for the sales strategy team. This work will focus on designing and executing strategic sales initiatives and providing operational systems, and analytical support for Global Sales Development.

In This Role, You Will

  • Provide data-driven operational and decision-making support to the Sales Development organization and management team.
  • Maintain the staffing and capacity for the Sales Development organization and partner with central planning teams to deliver our headcount plan.
  • Liaise with leadership to monitor KPIs and identify trends and opportunities to maximize impact.
  • Respond to business requests, perform root-cause analyses, and provide recommendations to solve problems and capture opportunities.
  • Support cross-functional programs, tools, processes, and systems to drive performance and productivity improvements.

We Are Looking For People Who

  • Are process-oriented and excel at creating and executing a clear operating cadence across a range of stakeholders.
  • Are highly analytical and can leverage raw, unorganized data into actionable insights and repeatable, scalable reporting.
  • Can adapt quickly to the evolving needs of a high-growth SaaS business and create pragmatic and innovative solutions to complex business problems.
  • Are comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment and interacting with senior stakeholders from various business functions.
  • Are driven to define the right metrics and analysis to produce actionable insights.
  • Proven SQL knowledge and experience.
  • Have 2+ years of professional experience.
  • Have B.A. or B.S. degree (An M.B.A. is a plus).

Role

Skills

HubSpot judges candidates on potential, not a list of skills. Folks that we’ve hired in the past include the following profiles:

  • Analytical Management Consultants with a mix of strategic and operational experience.
  • Sales Ops, Customer Ops, and FP&A professionals.
  • Technical folks with a passion for solving business problems.

We know the confidence gap and impostor syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form. This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.

At HubSpot, we value both flexibility and connection. Whether you’re a Remote employee or work from the Office, we want you to start your journey here by building strong connections with your team and peers. If you are joining our Engineering team, you will be required to attend a regional HubSpot office for in-person onboarding. If you join our broader Product team, you’ll also attend other in-person events such as your Product Group Summit and other gatherings to continue building on those connections.

If you require an accommodation due to travel limitations or other reasons, please inform your recruiter during the hiring process. We are committed to supporting candidates who may need alternative arrangements

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 13 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Licenciatura em Sistemas de Informação, Gestão, Engenharia ou áreas similares;
  • Valorizada a competência em integração e modelação de dados;
  • Proficiência em SQL e DAX;
  • Experiência nas ferramentas Python e Power BI;


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:


https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job:

High Level Data / Business Understanding:

As a Data / BI Analyst, you will enjoy tallying up numbers and communicating your findings & insights to a team leader / program owner. You will see different angles / stages of a product or business opportunity, and you will connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. You will work to effectively develop business questions into measurable metrics and provide meaningful recommendations on changes / improvements / next steps.

Execution Level Data Handling Skills:

As a Data / BI Analyst for Geo Data Insights and Analytics, you will work with complex data sets and pipelines that deliver business insights and drive change. You will work closely with Engineering, Operations and Product teams to track metrics and measure impact. As a data-loving member of the team, you will develop key performance indicators, define success factors, help establish benchmarks and serve as a technical data expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. Using your technical skills and business acumen, you’ll build reports, automated pipelines and dashboards so clients can quickly and accurately know how projects are performing. You will weave stories with meaningful insights and intuitive visualizations from data and make critical recommendations for partners from Engineering and Product Management teams.

Minimum qualifications:

● 3+ years of Analytics experience; Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaborate within a large team of analysts as well as cross-functionally with external engineering and product stakeholders.

● Experience in pulling data from datasets (i.e., SQL), applying transformations and data analysis to solve business problems. Top decile SQL skills are a must (experience in BigQuery is strongly preferred)

● Experience in using tools like Tableau/PowerBI for creating dashboards, intuitive visualizations and ad-hoc reports

● Bachelors or Masters in a quantitative field (such as Engineering, Statistics, Math, Economics, or Computer Science)

What We're Looking For:

● Ability to thrive in ambiguity & adapt to a fast paced environment with strong organizational and coordination skills

● A curious self starter who does not fear failure while exploring new datasets and run tests to understand the existing data structures & infrastructure without any/much documentation/guidance to rely on

● Ability to conduct root cause analysis and develop structured solutions while taking constraints into account

● Experience to articulate, translate, refine and prioritize product / business requirements into structured technical data requirements and conduct feasibility studies

● Experience with composing SQL scripts and to create datamarts / data warehouses along with its data pipelines.

● Experience with creation of dashboards and reports providing insight into business data. Aggregate, organize and visualize data to communicate effectively using presentation skills

● Strong verbal and written English communication skills with the ability to interact cross functionally with product analysts, data scientists, engineers, program managers, ops managers and other team members.

● Strong problem solving ability and quantitative support along with skills to think outside the box for creative solutions

● Ability to debug, optimize existing code and drive improvements to help reduce maintenance efforts on data infrastructure

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Introduction

Are you a natural-born business analyst eager to delve deep into the challenges of the business? Are you passionate about data, its accuracy, and its proper interpretation, and how these contribute to informed management decisions? Do you have a talent for presenting business insights and information through clear visualizations? Then we are looking for you!




Job description

As a business analyst, you act as the bridge between the product owners and the technical BI team. Through workshops and individual discussions, you quickly familiarize yourself with the business domain, analyze business requirements, and ensure their accurate interpretation.
You create visualization proposals and align them with your stakeholders, leveraging your ability to present insights and information clearly.
You translate your findings and analyses into a detailed analysis document.
You engage with application owners and source data owners to design functional data flows. With sufficient technical knowledge, you can ask critical questions.
You support the BI and DWH architect in designing an optimal BI solution.
You describe, plan, and organize functional tests in a concrete test plan, and you actively participate in these tests.
You ensure the quality of datasets and the reporting portfolio, providing clear presentations of datasets and reports while informing the organization and the customer.




Requirements

You have at least 3 years of experience as an analyst conducting functional, process, or business analyses and building bridges between the stakeholders and the tech experts.
You have experience with data modeling techniques and/or other analytical methods.
You communicate fluently and quickly grasp business domains.
Experience in a BI environment or with reporting tools is a plus.
You excel at presenting data attractively using visualization techniques. You value not only accurate data content but also clear and visually engaging presentations.
You are critical and prioritize data accuracy and correct interpretation.
You can work independently and take ownership of your tasks.
You are structured, highly analytical, and capable of setting priorities. You strike the right balance between abstraction and detail.
You work result-oriented with an eye for risks and quality.
You communicate fluently in English.
You hold a master’s degree (e.g., Computer Science, Economics, Business Engineering, Business Information Management) or a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent through experience.




Offer

22 Annual Vacation days, 3 sick days that are not carried over the next year (no medical certificate required), plus a seniority day added every 3 years in the company
Meal tickets
Private Medical Insurance
We offer flexibility when it comes to WFH policy
Wellbeing at the center - we know that there is more to our lives than our jobs, therefore we make sure to tackle well-being aspects of our day-to-day lives through specialized sessions, webinars, and internal programs according to our employee's input
In close cooperation is a value we live by, through #MomentsThatMatter: monthly hangout parties, team buildings, gamified online experiences
Many more to come :)

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Inetum Team and be part of a work culture focused on innovation!


Location: Lisbon


Main Responsibilities:

  • Create business-facing dashboards with high impact data visualizations and analysis with complex data structures;
  • Work closely with the other departments and entities to identify business needs;
  • Design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards using the appropriate tools;
  • ...


Profile:

  • Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar;
  • 2 years of experience in data analytics and dashboard development;
  • Strong experience with PowerBI:
  • Excellent communication skills;
  • Team work driven;
  • Fluent English (mandatory);
  • Hybrid work - office in Lisbon(1/2x per week).


Send your CV & join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Avant-garde Health

We are a mission-driven organization that was born out of the healthcare research at Harvard Business School led by Michael Porter and Bob Kaplan. We provide health systems, surgery centers, and physicians with comprehensive insights into their surgical care through our software, empowering them to improve their finances and deliver the best care possible to their patients. We integrate sophisticated analytics with deep industry knowledge. We are thought leaders, and our impactful work in improving healthcare efficiency and effectiveness has been recognized and featured in publications like the Harvard Business Review and The Wall Street Journal. We are well-capitalized and backed by leading VCs, including General Catalyst, Founder Collective, Fulcrum Equity Partners, and Tectonic Ventures. Join us in our mission to reshape healthcare through innovation and insight.




Position Overview

Avant-garde Health is seeking a Data Analyst to join our growing team. This position is ideal for a highly motivated professional with at least two years of relevant experience. The Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting sophisticated data analyses, providing actionable insights, and supporting the implementation of our analytical software solutions. You will play a critical role in delivering value to health systems, surgery centers, and physicians by optimizing their operational efficiency and financial performance.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate directly with health system leaders and clinicians to clearly understand their operational and financial objectives.
Perform in-depth analysis of complex healthcare datasets, extracting actionable insights and formulating strategic recommendations.
Support comprehensive project management activities, ensuring timely completion and delivery of project milestones.
Develop detailed client-facing presentations and reports to effectively communicate analytical insights and strategic guidance.
Provide ongoing client support, facilitating successful implementation and maximizing value derived from our software.
Actively contribute to internal initiatives aimed at continuously enhancing product functionality and increasing client satisfaction.




Qualifications

Minimum of two years of relevant professional experience, preferably within healthcare consulting, analytics, healthcare administration, or a related field.
Bachelor’s degree required; an advanced degree in healthcare management, business, or a related discipline preferred.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to interpret complex data.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; confident presenting insights to clients and internal stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills, capable of managing multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously.
Familiarity with healthcare industry standards, operations, and quality metrics preferred.
Proficiency with data analytics tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, SQL) highly desirable.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gupta Media was founded 20 years ago on the idea that advertising could create huge leverage in our client's business. Our early work was focused on the entertainment industry, specifically live events (Boston Calling, among others) and recorded music (Sony Music, Universal Music & Disney are all clients). We have dramatically grown our work with big brands (Amazon, Fender) and sports brands (LA Galaxy, Washington Commanders). We have a global client base with a growing local roster across B2B and B2C brands across campaign, content and branding assignments.




We are on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst to join our Strategy & Analytics team to assist with reporting, tracking, data analysis, advertising strategy, and visualization needs. In this role, you will work internally to assist paid media analysts with reporting requests as well as externally to provide clients with insights regarding their advertising campaigns.




If you are excited by the opportunity to improve reporting for our clients and our analysts, are able to communicate effectively to understand what tools will help solve a problem, and then work collaboratively to design a solution that’s scalable, accurate and easy-to-use, we want to talk to you.




Who You Are:

You have a true love for data. You have no problem tearing apart a problem and living inside a spreadsheet or data set to find the answer to any question.
You have advanced knowledge of SQL, Excel, and Google Data Studio/Data Visualization tools, and enjoy working with SQL on a day-to-day basis.
Experience with Marketing APIs, BigQuery or other cloud data warehouse tools (AWS, Snowflake, Databricks), ETL tools (such as Rivery, Looker, Supermetrics), and/or Python is a plus.
You have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field and at least 1 year of experience working with marketing data and/or paid advertising campaigns, preferably in a fast-paced agency environment or team structure.

What You’ll Do:




Reporting:

Maintain customized dashboards in Google Sheets and Excel on a daily/weekly cadence.
Use Advanced Excel, SQL, and Google Data Studio/Visualization Tools to generate pivot tables and other visualizations summarizing thousands of lines of data.
Translate performance media metrics into clear, digestible reports for client advertising campaigns.
Communicate insights effectively through Google Slides or PowerPoint decks.




Strategy:

Learn our clients’ businesses and align media strategy with their business goals.
Analyze advertising trends within a single project and across multiple projects to guide media buying strategy.
Apply your background in paid media and/or digital advertising, including understanding concepts like LTV, ROAS, and Incremental Revenue.
Engage in discussions with clients to build trust and gain stakeholder buy-in on media strategy and results.




At Gupta Media, we work hard every day to be better at all that we do — and that includes fostering a diverse and inclusive community that encourages and respects a broad range of backgrounds, experiences and ideas. Join us and help us find the next great idea.




Gupta Media is an office-first organization.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst I to support global operations through financial and market analysis. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, enjoys working on high-impact projects, and wants to contribute to a real-time, evolving global supply chain.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct financial and market analyses to inform hardware pricing, cost modeling, and scenario planning.
Support detailed project planning and execution, operational reporting, and ad-hoc business analyses for leadership.
Build evaluation frameworks to support cost-reduction initiatives.
Design tools and systems to adapt to rapidly evolving business needs.
Collaborate on tariff impact assessments and data-based recommendations.


Required Skills & Experience


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
3+ years of related experience in financial modeling, business analysis, or operations planning.
Advanced Excel skills ("Excel wizard" level required).
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with cost calculations or hardware/operations analysis is highly preferred.
Knowledge of SQL is a strong plus.
Comfortable working independently in a dynamic, fast-changing environment.


Preferred Traits


Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities.
Ability to build repeatable models and provide insights quickly (target: 48-hour turnaround).
Passion for continuous improvement and curiosity to explore new challenges.
Familiarity with global supply chain topics and the impact of international tariffs.


Performance Objectives


Deliver weekly actionable insights based on data.
Build repeatable Excel-based models for fast scenario analysis.
Maintain 95% accuracy in forecasting cost impacts.


Interview Process


1st Round: 45–60 minute resume-based interview.
2nd Round (if needed): Excel-based working session with team member.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

  • Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
  • Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$79,700 - $98,000

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity

At MassMutual, we’re passionate about helping millions of people find financial freedom and this passion has driven our approach to developing meaningful experiences for our customers. The Data Engineering team, part of MassMutual’s Enterprise Technology and Experience organization, is comprised of highly skilled, collaborative, problem solvers who are motivated to create innovative solutions that exceed the changing needs of our customers and move MassMutual – and the industry – forward.

To continue our cutting-edge work, we are hiring an Advanced Data Analyst to join our team.

The Team/Job

Our ideal Data Analyst/Developer - Mastery candidate is proficient in data management and has a strong analytical capability. You’ll use your skills to provide subject matter expertise and complete in-depth data analysis, which contribute to the strategic efforts of the team. You’re also detail-oriented and adaptable. The team culture of working collaboratively, cross-functionally, using new technologies combined with the work/life balance provided by MassMutual are core reasons people enjoy working on the Data Engineering team at MassMutual. The ideal candidate has strong hands-on experience with enterprise data platforms such as Vertica/Teradata, as well as a deep understanding of life insurance operations and analytics.

The Impact/Key Responsibilities


Analyze data related to life insurance operations including policy administration, reinsurance, reserves, and risk to generate actionable insights.
Develop and maintain comprehensive data mapping documents and work closely with data engineering teams to ensure accurate data integration and transformation.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs, and create reporting solutions aligned to strategic objectives.
Partner with data engineers, architects, and IT to validate datasets, optimize queries, and ensure scalable data pipelines.
Work directly with offshore teams to coordinate analysis, share requirements, and maintain consistent quality and delivery timelines.
Mentor junior analysts by reviewing their work, offering guidance, and promoting professional growth.
Define and implement standards for documentation, analysis, and data governance across the analytics team.
Apply strong data modeling knowledge (star/snowflake schema, normalization, dimensional modeling) to support efficient analysis and reporting.
Help Build dashboards, scorecards, and visualizations using Tableau, Power BI, or Strategy to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Ensure data quality and compliance with internal controls and industry regulations.


The Minimum Qualifications


Bachelors degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, or related technical field
8+ years of data analytics experience
3+ years hands-on experience with Vertica, Teradata or other similar tools for querying, performance optimization, and large-scale data analysis.
3+ years of experience with advanced SQL skills


The Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, or related technical field
8+ years of data analytics experience, including 5+ years within Finance domains.
Proficiency in Python
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Vertica, Teradata).
Familiarity with actuarial processes, reinsurance, or regulatory reporting requirements.
Industry certifications (e.g., LOMA, SOA exams) or data/BI certifications (e.g., Tableau, Microsoft).
Proven ability to write detailed source-to-target mapping documents and collaborate with technical teams on data integration.
Experience working in hybrid onshore-offshore team environments.
Deep understanding of data modeling concepts and experience working with relational and dimensional models.
Strong communication skills with the ability to clearly explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
A strong understanding of statistical concepts, probability and accounting standards, financial statements (balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement), and financial ratios.
Strong understanding of life insurance products and business processes across the policy lifecycle
Investment Principles: Knowledge of different asset classes, investment strategies, and financial markets.
Quantitative Finance: Understanding of financial modeling, risk management, and derivatives.
Regulatory Framework: Awareness of relevant financial regulations and compliance requirements.


MassMutual is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply. Note: Veterans are welcome to apply, regardless of their discharge status.

If you need an accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us and share the specifics of the assistance you need.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has an enterprise client that is seeking a Data Analyst in North Reading, MA. Summary: This is an opportunity to be involved in a top-of-mind topic in the global supply chain workspace. A rare opportunity to be a part of the ever-changing landscape with all the new tariffs in place. This is an interesting role for someone looking to be on the ground floor in creating information in real-time. Responsibilities:


Data Analyst will support effective decision-making through financial and market analysis of critical issues, including hardware price and cost modeling, and scenario planning
Execute detailed project plan timelines, operational reporting and conduct ad-hoc business analyses for leadership communication
Develop evaluation frameworks for product cost improvement initiatives
As a Data Analyst, you will design and coordinate the development of systems and tools to keep pace with the group's growing and rapidly changing businesses


Requirements


Undergraduate degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or a related field; A graduate level degree is nice-to-have but not required if the candidate has over 3 years of closely related experience or 5 years overall experience
Cost Calculation/Hardware knowledge
Fluency in standard software including MS Excel; Knowledge of SQL is a strong plus
Strong analytic skills and a demonstrated ability to build and manage financial models for business forecasting, variance analysis, and problem solving
Strong communication skills - both written and verbal
Successful characteristics for the position are the ability to maintain a high level of attention to detail, the ability to work independently, adjust priorities, and work in a continuously changing environment
Direct experience in operations or capacity planning a plus


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Lensa is the leading career site for job seekers at every stage of their career. Our client, Cardinal Health, is seeking professionals in Boston, MA. Apply via Lensa today!

Cardinal Health Sonexus™ Access and Patient Support helps specialty pharmaceutical manufacturers remove barriers to care so that patients can access, afford and remain on the therapy they need for a better quality of life. Our diverse expertise in pharma, payer and hub services allows us to deliver best-in-class solutions—driving brand and patient markers of success. We’re continuously integrating advanced and emerging technologies to streamline patient onboarding, qualification and adherence. Our non-commercial specialty pharmacy is centralized at our custom-designed facility outside of Dallas, Texas, empowering manufacturers to rethink the reach and impact of their products.

Together, we can get life-changing therapies to patients who need them—faster.

What Data Analytics Brings To Cardinal Health

The Data & Analytics Function oversees the analytics life-cycle in order to identify, analyze and present relevant insights that drive business decisions and anticipate opportunities to achieve a competitive advantage. This function manages analytic data platforms, the access, design and implementation of reporting/business intelligence solutions, and the application of advanced quantitative modeling.

Data Analytics applies business process knowledge and data analytics to develop, recommend and communicate timely, accurate, relevant and actionable insights to support business decisions and objectives.

Responsibilities


Works with the business team to understand business rules, data flow and appropriately create reporting and analytics for the program.
Works with complex datasets to perform exploratory data analysis to provide insights to make business decisions.
This role combines consultative and technology focus to Data Analytics.
The individual should be skilled in bridging gap between technology and operations.
We require a motivated person who is interested in performing exploratory data analysis with complex datasets with minimal direction.
Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects


Qualifications


BA, BS or equivalent experience in related field
4-8 years experience in a related field preferred
Client facing experience preferred
Advance Excel experience (including Macros) preferred
Intermediate to Advance SQL
Intermediate to Advance Tableau
Patient/Hub Service experience is preferred
Experience in Rare Disease Patient Analytics or Provider Analytics preferred
Call Center Data Analytics preferred
Experience working in data feeds (Data Aggregators)


What is expected of you and others at this level:


May contribute to the development of policies and procedures
Works on complex projects of large scope
Develops technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organization objectives
Completes work independently receives general guidance on new projects
Work reviewed for purpose of meeting objectives
May act as a mentor to less experienced colleagues


R Emote Details

You will work remotely, full-time. It will require a dedicated, quiet, private, distraction free environment with access to high-speed internet. We will provide you with the computer, technology and equipment needed to successfully perform your job. You will be responsible for providing high-speed internet. Internet requirements include the following:


Maintain a secure, high-speed, broadband internet connection (DSL, Cable, or Fiber) at the remote location. Dial-up, satellite, WIFI, Cellular connections are NOT acceptable.
Download speed of 15Mbps (megabyte per second).
Upload speed of 5Mbps (megabyte per second).
Ping Rate Maximum of 30ms (milliseconds).
Hardwired to the router.
Surge protector with Network Line Protection for CAH issued equipment.


Anticipated salary range: $79,700 - $113,000

Bonus eligible: No

Benefits: Cardinal Health offers a wide variety of benefits and programs to support health and well-being.


Medical, dental and vision coverage
Paid time off plan
Health savings account (HSA)
401k savings plan
Access to wages before pay day with myFlexPay
Flexible spending accounts (FSAs)
Short- and long-term disability coverage
Work-Life resources
Paid parental leave
Healthy lifestyle programs


Application window anticipated to close: 06/20/2025 *if interested in opportunity, please submit application as soon as possible.

The salary range listed is an estimate. Pay at Cardinal Health is determined by multiple factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s geographical location, relevant education, experience and skills and an evaluation of internal pay equity.

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

To read and review this privacy notice click here (https://www.cardinalhealth.com/content/dam/corp/email/documents/corp/cardinal-health-online-application-privacy-policy.pdf)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
With more than 90,000 babies born since 1986, Boston IVF is one of the most experienced fertility centers in the world. We proudly offer the most innovative fertility treatments, groundbreaking reproductive technologies – and so much more. We diagnose the most difficult cases. We instill hope. We offer advice and a shoulder to lean on when our patients need it most. Our sole mission is to provide individuals and couples with the best chance for a successful pregnancy – and each day we cherish the bonds we form with our patients.




Boston IVF has a fulltime Data Analyst II position at our Waltham Facility. The Data Analyst II will report directly to the Director of Data Operations.




Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

As a Data Analyst II, you will:

Work across all company applications to maintain and enhance data integrity for both current and historical data
Manage and provide explanations for key metrics and figures displayed in existing Excel reports
Respond to report requests from various departments, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of data
Collaborate with the Director of Data Operations on database programming and scripting
Develop and implement new tools to automate workflows and improve efficiency across the company







Requirements (including but not limited to):

· 3–5 years of experience with Microsoft Excel (required, non-negotiable)

o Strong proficiency with PivotTables and PivotCharts (required, non-negotiable)

o Advanced knowledge of Excel formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP(), INDIRECT(), IFERROR(), etc.) (required, non-negotiable)

o Familiarity with macros/VBA (preferred but not required)

· Strong computer skills—must be tech-savvy with excellent keyboarding skills

· Proficiency in SQL/query languages and understanding of database relationships

· Experience creating detailed reports and explaining key metrics when needed

· Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills

· Bachelor’s degree required

· Strong communication and interpersonal skills—ability to work well in a team







Additional knowledge/skills preferred but not required

· Knowledge/experience in the medical field

· Experience with Filemaker

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
**Hybrid Onsite 2 days/week in Cambridge, MA**




Business/Data Analyst- Commercial Pharma Experience




Description

We are seeking a skilled Business/Data Analyst to join our team at a leading biotech company. In this role, you'll document data/reporting for our Therapeutic Area, gather business requirements, and facilitate stakeholder meetings. Collaborate with marketing leaders and technical teams to shape solutions and ensure compliance with industry regulations. Your SQL expertise and strong analytical skills will drive success. Apply now to make a meaningful impact in the biotech industry.




Rate: $50 - $58/hr




Due to client requirement, applicants must be willing and able to work on a w2 basis. For our w2 consultants, we offer a great benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits, 401k with company matching, and life insurance.




Responsibilities

Document current state of data / reporting for the TA
Gather and document business requirements from commercial stakeholders for analytics, reporting, and system enhancements.
Facilitate stakeholder meetings, requirements workshops, and feedback sessions to ensure alignment on priorities.
Support territory alignments, incentive compensation inputs, and targeting strategies and modifications to existing data and reporting
Ensure compliance with industry regulations, data privacy policies (e.g., HIPAA), and internal standards.
SQL knowledge and experience working and having logical / conceptual understanding of datasets – including KPIs, metrics etc.
Strong analytical, communication, and stakeholder management skills
Power BI skills would be a plus, to build dashboards or reports only if needed.




Experience Requirements

Pharma/Life Sciences/Biotech industry experience.




Education Requirements

Bachelor's Degree







Skills, experience, and other compensable factors will be considered when determining pay rate. The pay range provided in this posting reflects a W2 hourly rate; other employment options may be available that may result in pay outside of the provided range.




W2 employees of Eliassen Group who are regularly scheduled to work 30 or more hours per week are eligible for the following benefits: medical (choice of 3 plans), dental, vision, pre-tax accounts, other voluntary benefits including life and disability insurance, 401(k) with match, and sick time if required by law in the worked-in state/locality.

If you have any indication of fraudulent activity, please contact InfoSec@eliassen.com.

Business/Data Analyst- Commercial Pharma Experience


Description

We are seeking a skilled Business/Data Analyst to join our team at a leading biotech company. In this role, you'll document data/reporting for our Therapeutic Area, gather business requirements, and facilitate stakeholder meetings. Collaborate with marketing leaders and technical teams to shape solutions and ensure compliance with industry regulations. Your SQL expertise and strong analytical skills will drive success. Apply now to make a meaningful impact in the biotech industry.


Rate: $50 - $58/hr


Due to client requirement, applicants must be willing and able to work on a w2 basis. For our w2 consultants, we offer a great benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits, 401k with company matching, and life insurance.

  • Gather and document business requirements from commercial stakeholders for analytics, reporting, and system enhancements.

  • Ensure compliance with industry regulations, data privacy policies (e.g., HIPAA), and internal standards.
